1sVkTHSeJcP00zlvhCUsyA.text: Live down the street and love great Cajun food. They serve authentic plates. We have had the gumbo and etouffee. Both are incredible! Prices are reasonable and worth the quality. Definitely recommended.

ElfS63oJMSSjvoZ-Iz8oLA.text: What a great little place. The food and atmosphere were awesome (really enjoyed the music, made me feel like we were in New Orleans, or watching one of my favorite shows...miss you Treme). Our waiter was great and the serving portions were just right (the chicken and sausage gumbo was soooo tasty, and really digged the homemade chips). The only reason I did not give 5-stars is that I felt it was just a wee-bit pricy for lunch (but you will have to forgive me, as I am a bit of a bargain hunter).  We enjoyed our visit when they were located in Phoenix, and were very pleased to see that they relocated closer to home (our home of course). I am looking forward to their future expansion, which should allow for more seating as well as a more attractive bar area. (also thank you so much for cleansing my mind and body of our earlier horrible Coco's experience).

-yVzRJCMuaCqe1DnZAK4-g.text: We love the food at Baby Kays!! Tonight though we had something happen which left a bad taste in our mouths!  When my party of 6 arrived we told our waiter that we would be needing 4 seperate checks and we were led to believe that this was not a problem.When our check came he told us that it would take him too long to figure it out seperately and that we should do it ourselves on the back of the bill and write out our seperate amounts so he could give us all our seperate total! I thought thats what I was paying him to do???  NEVER IN MY LIFE HAVE I HAD TO FIGURE OUT AND SEPERATE MY OWN BILL AND WRITE IT DOWN FOR THE WAITER! If seperate checks was a problem we should have been told so at the beginning of our evening and we could have adjusted accordingly!  If we all were at 4 different tables we would have recieved seperate checks, so what was the problem! This was very annoying to me and it is unfortuanate because food was great as always and the service was great up to that point! If seperate checks are a problem then please tell your guests up front so this never happens again!! It's too bad a fun night out with friends left us in a bad mood at the end of out evening!! Will I still eat at Baby Kays?  Yes! I just hope they take this consructive criticism to heart and change things accordingly!

JoRihVB-qXS6ps9V_ST2vg.text: Enjoyed the catfish dinner the cornbread batter was light and not heavy on salt. They have a guitar/violin player who plays along with recorded music ala karaoke. He plays a good mix of instrumental music. Service was good and prompt. The only negative I had was the standard sauce that came with catfish was a horseradish very potent. Lucky there was a bottle of pepper sauce on table saved the evening.  There are additional sauces available but they cost extra. Green olive coleslaw was good. We will be back

oYy18mvMGEX_jv4YGuwvbA.text: This place had a good vibe and pretty interesting entertainment with a musician freestyling to popular songs. My girlfriend and I had a good experience overall with quality and service. We ordered the cajun combination and the cornish game hen. The house salad was not too appetizing but when is a house salad really going to impress anyone anyway. The cornish game hen and the crawfish etoufee were really good. The only downside is that the chicken gumbo wasn't that great and most of the dishes were on the salty side. That's the only downsides. If I ever were to come again I would totally get the crawfish etoufee.

teN0htbUjCRVpph48GNdeA.text: Awesome Jambalaya and Seafood Gumbo.  Don't go to a chain for imitation, this is the real thing.  I was offered samples and took them up on.  Ended up having 1/2 shrimp poboy and Seafood Gumbo with cole slaw.  Coworker with me had Combo platter with potato salad.  Beers from Louisiana available.  I travel to Scottsdale/Phx quite often and will be back for sure

1BL7_Z1zl1Or2ZlksPImEA.text: Now I am not a Cajun food expert but on a recommendation yesterday I stopped in to give it a shot. I ordered the shrimp and catfish por boy and the seafood gumbo (asked them to throw a little sausage in for kicks).  I tried the gumbo and the flavors were so rich and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  Sent the por boy with husband today for his lunch after slowly reheating it. I will let you know what he thinks later.  I will be back and strange as it sounds but it just might be today!!!!

2Pg6qmiFXYElxnHcXnbDCg.text: service is erratic and rice is dense. expect at least 6 quirky service incidents, including temporarily stealing your credit card. make sure you call if you are running late from your reservation time or they will get testy. dude on violin adds to the charm of the sausage.

XkcNGQKcQV-4UR8RURL38Q.text: One of the first pregnancy cravings I have had was Cajun food.  I found this place online and had to give it a try.  Great food,  great staff.  I was so impressed by thier food we will be going back.  I had the crawfish etouffee and it was truly amazing!

hseJjaS_ViLCnhHwbIFbJQ.text: We didn't even know this place existed (in Mesa) until a few weeks ago but we tried some take-out today and were happy we did.  My wife, the sea food eater, LOVED the crab cakes and we both shared and enjoyed the red beans & rice, jambalaya, pulled pork sliders and original chicken wings.  The wings were some of the best we've ever had anywhere!  Also tried the cup of gumbo, dirty rice and potato salad, all of which were very good.  A really nice extra was the garlic bread that came with our food - absolutely fantastic!  Since there are really no other authentic cajun places around, we'll be going back to Baby Kay's...often!

uLcQX56SbI8it3ScKMdPOg.text: Been a Baby Kays fan since the first one on Shoeman Lane in Snottsdale.  Any review less than 4 stars is either a competitor or needs to put down the pipe.  Green olive slaw is simply fantastic.  Love the Cajun Combination and recommend it for newbies.  Their Friday night Smothered Southern Pork Chops have a huge fan base.  But I'll always be a sucker for the crawfish etouffee.....sprinkled with a little extra cayenne.  Thanks to Kay for bringing her authentic recipes from Louisiana, and to the girls that are carrying on the legacy of great food and friendly service.

11n4ZkHBsUcELys_O69mSw.text: Total meh fest. I went with a group of 10 or so and it took an hour for our food to come. Being someone that doesn't care for spicy food, the sandwich I got was quite boring. Some people that like Cajun enjoy this place though.

J-FCM8OnhyIFYuxi-rTDOw.text: So glad this restaurant is near my house.    The etouffee is delicious.   The live music is right out of New Orleans.    I'd go here once a week if I could.

2d2BML5A-fIozbrOLk6oFA.text: We received the friendliest, most attentive service here tonight. The server took time to answer questions about the menu and offered suggestions. This was one of those rare occasions where you're waited on and the server genuinely seems happy helping you. The Fetuccuni Alfredo with shrimp had some spice, but not too much for someone like myself who can't take a lot of it. I strongly dislike coleslaw but their olive version is great. It was pleasantly surprising and really is an interesting twist. The restaurant itself is clean, well maintained, and the decor is fitting.

yTY9LNKwbjNaSPrD3r4_IQ.text: Ok...I'm not from New Orleans or (N'awlins) but I have had authentic creole.  Right out of the gate the sweet tea needs work...seriously if this is supposed to be southern you'll need to improve it quite a bit (let this southern boy know if you need some help).  The hush puppies came out and I was immediately nervous because they smelled like they were burned, however they were very crisp and perfect consistency on the inside with great flavor along with horseradish sauce.  I ordered the cajun combination and everything was great. I'm not going to say that the gumbo is incredible in fact it was a touch bland but it was still passable.  The jambalaya was flavorful and was much better than I expected.  Now, the piece de resistance...the etouffee was phenomenal!!! I have been searching for a place that does this right and I have found it!  I would not usually give a high rating because of the few inadequacies but the etouffee blasted this place out of the park for me.  The service was prompt and friendly and major kudos (maybe small to some but it is that little extra) they packed my leftovers for me.  Also, this is the only Cajun joint that I know of that serves it up this good in AZ (seriously I think you 'Trina refuges need to get to work opening up some more worth while joints)!

6HS2EdnXcXlFGO9UhTxo0Q.text: The food was great, ambience was nice and the servers were quick to serve.  They even had a guy playing guitar and violin, but at a quiet level (so you can converse).  I liked that they have a bunch of the dishes as small happy hour offerings.  I will definitely be back.

XmGerOxdorQ0cwEYliueWA.text: Best food ever!   The fried chicken on Thursday nights is amazing.  The jambalaya incredible.  The pork chop falls right off the bone.  The andouille sausage is amazing.  Atmosphere is AWESOME.  Live jazz blues music on Fridays and Saturdays. The staff always friendly and glad to see you.

-t_keyBi823CORrLe1rHZQ.text: Can't give it 5 stars even with the exceptional food. The Chicken & Sausage gumbo is fantastic but at $1 1.50 a bowl it's quite expensive for what you get. Sorry I can't return

n0uPD1QO4drARVeoUgdiyg.text: Can't get enough.  Takes me right back to NOLA and Bourbon street

V46vzmbvpKPIhSBc5iroaQ.text: Baby Kay's has transformed the space previously occupied by Cajun Seafood Corner. Gone is the kitsch of 1980s New Orleans, to be pleasantly replaced with a more subtle and austere atmosphere reminscent of an underground jazz joint. The bar still features prominently at the front, but has a classy vibe. The restaurant has doubled it's space, adding enough tables to handle the Friday night crowd very well while leaving a good corner open for some live Jazz guitar. We started with a basket of hushpuppies served with ketchup and remoulade for dipping. We ordered a Cajun Combo, and Baby Kay's Combo. The olive slaw I received was cool, creamy, and crisp, topped with a blackening seasoning that I though overpowered it a bit. The gumbo was sniffle-inducing and wonderful, with a very earthy flavor and a good amount of meat in it. The crawfish etoufee was the highlight of my experience. Where I had expected minced meats, I found whole crawfish pieces (sans shell) that tasted sweet and fresh. The dish was full and flavorful, sweet but with a pleasant spice to it. I must admit that at this point, I had to surrender. I simply did not have enough room left for the jambalaya, which I am enjoying as I type this. Sticky and soft, I think it does not stand up against other's I've had. Overall, this restaurant offered great service even while busy, the atmosphere took me straight to Bourbon Street and left me wanting to return to tackle the rest of the menu, Po' Boys and some great dessert options. 5 out of 5 Fat Guy Points.

jkBiyB2XHoY5OuO4Wz4_Mw.text: If you like spicy food then this is the place for you. I had the fettuccine in a spicy cream sauce with andouille sausage ($13.50). It comes with garlic toast and a side (I got the green olive slaw). The food was excellent and a huge portion (I took home more than I ate). The service was great. The decor was New Orleans camp (lots of skeleton stuff).   My friend had the fried catfish and shrimp basket with fries ($12.95). The fish was fine, but the fries were just ordinary freezer bag fries. She said her food was OK.  The restaurant is clean and parking is close to the door. They have live music on Tuesday evening and the weekend evenings. There is a mix of tables and chairs and some booths. There is also a small patio area. I recommend this local business.

FpWEg1jKU8CCpy0ECACmdg.text: Finally got in here to try out some of their delicious Cajun food. They had previously been in a couple other locations and I had always seemed to miss visiting them both.  This place cooks some really tasty food and the insides are well decorated with plenty of Louisiana style decorations as well as several cool looking mardi gras paintings and other fun items on the walls.  We came here on a business lunch and had the chance to get here right when they opened. Service was very friendly and the food came out rather quickly. They even have an area for a guitarist that plays during special occasions. NICE!  We started with some of their Lulu's Sweet and Spicy Tabasco Wings and a cup of Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. The wings were large and fried just right and the sauce had some nice tangy flavors. The gumbo was also very good and had just the right amount of heat.  The guys ordered the fried Catfish and Shrimp entree and the Jambalaya with Andouille Sausage. Yours truly went with the Catfish covered in Crawfish Etouffee Sauce and a side of their Olive Coleslaw. Everything was spectacular and tasted just like what you get while visiting the New Orleans area.  The menu here is not very large and missing some of the popular blacked fish dishes that you usually see down south. Would like to see a few more types of seafood and possibly some spicy bacon wrapped cheese stuffed shrimp or some alligator options.  Definitely will be coming back again to try out some of their other specialties like their yummy Po'Boys and their different types of Etouffees and Gumbos. Cajun food is hard to find in the AZ desert and they do a great job. AHYEE!  4.25 STARS

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Catfish Dinner with Crawfish Sauce. My favorite!
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Cup of Seafood Gumbo. Better than my Galveston TX recipe.
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Catfish with Crawfish Étouffée Sauce. So Good!

PrudqA06AXbHnDasPNmO7Q.text: Like others say, get the chicken wings! Sauce was great, but it is your personal preference to have it on the side or all over the wings. We appreciate awesome chicken and they deliver! So it was on the side for us. The sauce was great and we took some home. Also the Gumbo, I've never had gumbo before and it was a mouth full of flavors exploding in my mouth with the perfect amount of heat that makes you want more and more! Run, don't walk, get there as soon as you can! Man-oh-Man, save room for the chocolate sundae.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Awesome Sundae!
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. great artwork lines the walls.
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Dining room

CZ78h6xmR49ka-xr2im3zg.text: Awesome crawfish conffitte. Would highly recommend the combination player with the jambalaya and chicken/sausage gumbo and crawfish conffitte. Catfish is amazing as well. Live blues music by an older gentleman. Don't go thinking he'll blow your mind, not by a long shot. It's more about the ambiance which really makes you feel like you're in Louisiana.

RjQ3mU5B7putqyWbhmjXNA.text: Baby Kay's has alright food and alright prices. Nothing from my two experiences that would blow the mind for greatness.   I believe they have new owners now and we had experienced big ownership.   The old owners the food was really good but the service was absolutely terrible! I mean terrible. The owners were not friendly and made you feel awkward going there, but I liked he food so occasionally still went.  With the new ownership it has changed to really great service! Unfortunately the food really wasn't spectacular so I never went back.  They just need to make good sized portions and have more flavor... It just wasn't quite enough to get us back.

RRa1hTBcYTYnb8dXggmhOA.text: For a quick lunch I order the half catfish po-boy with a side of potato salad and seafood gumbo. The food was OK, the sandwich was the only thing I finished. The potato salad didn't have much flavor and just tasted bland.   I thought it was expensive for a lunch meal. I paid $16 total and ordered water because I do not drink soda. I haven't been back because I am a fan of good prices almost everything on the menu was over $11 even for a sandwich.

0mfwt5Ivzo6w4Vc7sBm95A.text: I had the fettuccine with cream sauce (added chicken) it was really good. The sauce had a little spice to it and the serving size was generous. I think this will end up as my go-to dish when I come here. The hush puppies were light and crisp served with a tarter sause and a ketchup.  I did not try the ketchup because after I had the tarter sauce, I just wanted to eat as much of that as I could. I think they mixed some horseradish in it. So good.   The restaurant had a cool, laid-back atmosphere. The music was great and so was the artwork (most of which was for sale). Service was OK but the place was not busy when we were there so I would expect it to be fine.  I'll be back. I just wish it wasn't all the way in Mesa.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Fettuccine with spicy cream sause and chicken.

Uk1zVSx1Qbe5uvr_L8vH8Q.text: Baby Kay's is amazing! The service was great. Very friendly and prompt. The crab cakes were delicious and had a great sauce to dip them in. I also really loved the jambalaya and chicken and sausage gumbo. They definitely cook with spice, so if you have trouble with that I probably wouldn't recommend this place. Great flavors with everything we had. If you're interested in dessert, the bread pudding was fabulous, just like everything else.

hEW-McFLaOd_kTp5uU-1fA.text: Best cajun in the valley!! Always busy, but for good reason. Also have great drinks for awesome prices!!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Tequila and Tonic + Glass of Merlot = $10...I&#39;ll take it

U51keoum5HVGyMOpglV7UQ.text: We love Baby Kay's! My husband and I have been fans for over 25 years. Their Chicken Gumbo is to die for! We were there last Saturday night, bit of a drive for us & we were so excited to be there but we were so disappointed in the ambiance. They had KSLX blasting, really?! I love rock n roll but there were commercials more than music on that station. And it's surprising they don't have Pandora or something. We asked them to turn it down especially so we could hear the live entertainment, but they didn't. The first waitress that seated us made a passive aggressive comment to us when we asked for a certain table rather than her first choice. The bright light was our new waiter started his shift with us as one of his tables. I forgot his name but he's new there. Great service and nice personality. We will go back, of course!

yiAcnSO8NzHNCSj4kzD-Yw.text: Delicious food need more servers so they can visit table to see if anything is needed. Music was nice place was clean and food was fresh

Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Catfish
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Garlic toast

IqFRi2l7QpFY2uYcOtC2hA.text: My dad and I have been coming here for a while. Hands down one of the best places to eat. I recently moved out of state and I find myself craving their food all the time. My favorite dish is the BBQ shrimp. So flavorful, and delicious. Their salads are amazing too! My boyfriend loves their shrimp etouffee almost as much as I love him! HA!  The service is always awesome! We have never had a bad experience here. You can tell the owners take great pride in their food and their restaurant. Plus you can't beat Dino playing the guitar. Such smooooooooth music. Cannot wait to get back to AZ!

Olcwa7HyAKUiMz9bhGoobQ.text: Best restaurant as far as service and the food is great! Service has always been exceptional and environment is super laid back and welcoming. Love it. And... the food is really good.

XX8PcyPaCUzhwuL0dC07eQ.text: Tried this place after a recommendation from a friend. The chicken gumbo was really good, white rice was prefect and fluffy while the red beans were fantastic. Can't wait to go back and try something new.

gUEGl899h4vE33Wxsq-wwA.text: Yo this place was LIT ya'll. I literally felt like I was on Bourbon Street in NOLA. The food here tastes very similar to what is found in NOLA and they kept the entire menu creole/Cajun. They didn't try to put a southwest spin on the flavor. I got the fried catfish and got the wings are appetizers. The service isn't bad either but its almost like a tv series. It starts off slow but then it takes off. The best part was the live music played by someone who know how to play an electric guitar and blues music.

xWkVL9KwEaqV8km7pJgDbg.text: I alwaus get the Baby K sampler all and still go home with food. I love the oysters most of all and the food is seasoned well.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Baby K sampler

oSD0pmRAw7O-n40s0Asewg.text: Holy creoley in your mouth  Their duck and andouille sausage is a delicious starter to get your palate all wet and excited. Then kick off the fireworks with the catfish dish covered in crawfish etouffee  All while being serenaded by the sexiest of blues musicians. If you can't tell, I'm in love.

DTSXnhCJK-KqKkfQa3jilA.text: I'm so glad I gave baby Kay's a chance. I am from Louisiana and I am usually highly critical of Cajun/creole cooking. I was pleasantly surprised. The hush puppies were delish, not greasy at all. The etouffee was very well seasoned and the lulu  LuLu wings are a winner for sure. I am going to be heading back on one of the live music nights so I can get the full experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

Rj9GzcR9bBm1GkEtnfNjQA.text: This is the real deal! Cajun food authentic. Blues music in the background. Setting is your typical Arizona strip mall, but once inside it's "hello bayou goodbye desert. Had the combination plate, etouffe, jambalaya, seafood gumbo. Garlic bread. Will be back!

Ww5p6QYuDVRrJd56UiXMPg.text: This place is amazing! Went with the coworkers. Showed up with 7. No wait for lunch, immediately got seated. The food was great! Great value! Bathrooms were SUPER clean! Good so good I forgot to take a picture until I dug in... had crab cakes and seafood basket. Loved the crab cakes and spicy mayo!!!

tjDAiFMnWpYHertIrrh1Kw.text: Awesome! My wife and I just came to the area from NJ and after a long flight, we were hungry and wanted something different.  Well this place didn't disappoint.  I had seafood gumbo and the misses had the appetizer combo with dirty rice.  Hmmm, hmmm good.  Gumbo had a good amount of heat to not over power your taste buds.  My wife's combo had a good kick as well. Portions are nice size and the service was very friendly.  Excellent Cajun twist in the Phoenix area.

QTPaSQSs2De-teSC--wwnw.text: Ate dinner here with the family tonight. WOW! Everything was amazing! We started with the sampler, it had catfish shrimp fried oysters qnd jalapeno poppers, yum. The star of the night was the crawfish etouffee...AMAZEBALLS! Some of the best I have ever had, and yes that includes New Orleans. Also tried the fried catfish with crawfish sauce and again, Amazing!  Sorry for sounding all excited but it has been so long since I've had great cajun food. Only down side was service was a little slow, but it was a Friday so that is understandable. Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Great music!

lZ4n4E1Nw2agEijy5n1w1A.text: This is the closest thing to NOLA you will find in this city.  Everything they serve is good, the catfish, the etoufee, gumbo, jambalaya, you name it.  The lunch specials are fantastic, try the seafood enchiladas on Tuesday.  I can't believe I'm going to post this here because I don't like competition when it comes ot getting my order (they run out), but they have a crawfish boil on Wednesday night, it is AWESOME.  I have friends who are from LA and they swear by this place.  I am new but a dedicated fan.  If you don't like this place, you probably don't like this kind of food or you are just a weirdo.  Anyone who gave it less than 4 stars must be from the 70s because they are on ludes.

p1uK3AIuRS5v53ek5AgzCg.text: First time here and we enjoyed it. Our waitress was very friendly and helped us newbies thru the menu. We both had the combination basket, one with catfish and shrimp, and the other with catfish, shrimp, and oysters. My favorite was the shrimp and melt-in-your mouth oysters.  We both added a dinner salad; the ranch dressing was delicious. The gentleman playing guitar was wonderful and set the mood beautifully. Will definitely add this to our dinner out rotation.

B6FTjZ2JKLibOVhOQw5YRg.text: Impressed with the staff and the food.  Not fancy, but clean and neat.  Friendly staff and great service.  I had seafood basket with catfish, oysters and shrimp.  Cooked just right with reasonable price.  My wife loved the jambalaya so much, she almost ordered one to go.  All good, no complaints, but we just left before the monsoon blew over the tree in the parking lot.  Might be our lucky spot.

QVzu2dyld1-w3PCy50nsYQ.text: We would have gone 3.5 stars, the food was good, the service was really good.  The food was a bit too spicy for me, but my husband thought it was pretty good. I asked if you can order it mild and was told not at this time.  The atmosphere was good and there was live music!

P539aWMkJ57HKXVofLx-sQ.text: Finally tried Baby Kay's and I'm in love! The chicken and andouille sausage gumbo was great! Comparable to gumbo that I've had in actual New Orleans! Hush puppies were yummy too, especially dipped in the remoulade sauce! The garlic bread gives your tastebuds a nice break from the spice of the gumbo and the Cajun vinaigrette salad dressing is to die! Can't wait to go back and try more things!

yIudS5_9nyNyuudhB2dvKQ.text: Best food in Phoenix by far, nothing comes close. I have eaten here for over 20 years and never had anything bad. Kilt Lifter on tap seals the deal.

mDndbBqYtAtInfavLeIUoQ.text: Delicious po boys and awesome service. glad we moved to this neighborhood. we'll be back

V1GYmB9_sW2wAhp8q5uBZg.text: This place is amazing. The Friday/Saturday pork chop special is unlike anything I've ever had before... just make sure to get there early since it seems to always sell out early.

DFO5aE49z2X310Yzb0p42g.text: A friend and myself stopped in for lunch.  The place was pretty busy, a good sign.  We sat at "the bar".  It is not much of a bar but when most of the tables are full it will do.  I had the oyster Po' Boy with a side of hush puppies.  The sandwich itself was ok but the homemade potato chips tasted stale.  The hushpuppies were good but nothing special.  The ones at the Angry Crab are much better.  My friend had the Cajun Combo with the seafood gumbo.  He said it was good but nothing real special.  He did like the potato salad.  I think that the prices are a little high.  Another thing is that I have never eaten in a Cajun restaurant that did not have boiled crawfish on the menu.....that is until I ate here.  I don't know about you but when I hear Cajun, crawfish is the first thing that comes to my mind.  Not with these owners though. Anyway, not bad, just not good enough to want to go back.

yBGmHmpgUd7U-IDdwJ6aUA.text: A little warm inside, but best cajun food coupled with great service.  The fried chicken, pork chops and etouffee are must-haves.  sometimes they have live music and serve Abita.

7qQ5axs-wTRL5ZwNnrguYQ.text: Good service, good people but, my jumbylia was seasoned with green peppers. I have never had jumbylia seasoned with green peppers. Red peppers are king in cajun food. Don't get me wrong, it was "ok"  but, not like that made by my grandma or my family (from Louisiana). I will give them another try. There are not enough cajun food places in AZ.

CHl5l_VcgjDRmhuFdUXYRw.text: Had the half catfish sandwich and chicken & sausage gumbo and it was fantastic!!!! Excited to have another great local place to visit for lunch and dinner in Phoenix. :-)

wpZxSaD3bb2_qiDVGrnn4w.text: Stopped here while I was in the area for something different. It was during lunch and had a break in my day. Service was prompt and good. Had the jambalaya with cole slaw and rice.  The spiciness is up there with a good Mexican dish. Rice was not the best but not the worst either, it looked like instant and had been sitting for a bit. Cole slaw...... No, I've had better at Church's Chicken. BUT, I didn't go hungry.

2UwutBPXf8yit3rx0Aavsg.text: Service left a lot to be desired. The bartender was my waitress although I wasn't seated at the bar. So yeah.  I ordered the crawfsh ettoufe. Really good. Spicy!  The rice cuts the heat though. I give the dish 5 stars (the entree price is $19) . The potato salad that it came with wasn't good at all. Very dry (couldn't taste any mayo) but was heavy on relish. It just was bad. The garlic bread tasted frozen. So yeah. It's ok. The 3 stars instead of 4 are for slow service (asked for more rice and waitress/bartender forgot) and the price is steep for what it is.

2ZTSsxt-zy9CuBSORPMPrg.text: Went later (8:30) on Friday night, but still busy and had to wait 30 minutes for a table; after that VERY slow service and had to ask to order. After the initial order, waiter was very nice and accommodating. Food -etoufee and fried catfish were both outstanding. Lots extra to take home. Key lime pie just an ok. Really enjoyed the live music (only till 9).

FSllV2m_VYOZ2Qw_475uBg.text: We showed up on a Friday evening just before it got really busy. Our server was extremely friendly and even brought us a sample of the Cajun Combination which I ordered. It was delicious! I highly recommend this place for great Cajun food and a lovely atmosphere.

MPMS6ch9IfKRQHdisEY9EA.text: Being a Cajun - decided to try out this place and I am so glad I did!  The food is so very spicy and yummy.  If you are a fellow Cajun (or someone who likes good and spicy dishes) I  STRONGLY recommend giving it a try!

xOqFhH4Ltx7wnrLiWI6-NA.text: The sampler platter was good.  The gumbo needs some work.  Enjoyed the ambience and the laid back scenery.  Good place to chill with your significant other.

HQ1FPuYRl0a448vaGUXeuA.text: Easily the best gumbo etoufee and jambalaya I have had in the valley! Perfectly seasoned and spicy and didn't require any additional Tobasco or anything. I will definitely be back... I had the Cajun combination that came with a side salad / French bread / and a cup each of chicken and sausage gumbo, crawfish etoufee, and chicken and sausage jambalaya

IhGy96u04MTBqwL_FNb3_g.text: Baby Kay's was a random find of ours, but the food was so good, we went back there only 4 days after our initial visit and have returned a few times since!  We've tried a few different menu items including the crab cakes, gumbo, shrimp po boy, jambalaya, stuffed chicken, seafood enchiladas, and shrimp etouffee. I have not had Cajun food elsewhere but if it tastes anything like the dishes served here then totally sign me up! I'm sure it's expected but everything is a bit on the spicy-side with a lot of different seasonings.  Our favorites so far have been the gumbo & shrimp etouffee because of the flavors. I only tried a bite but the crawfish etouffee was amazing as well! I would say that the only disappointment so far has been the shrimp po boy. I didn't find it to be as tasty as I expected it to be especially compared to the other items.  They offer special menu items (changes daily) as well as live music on some of the nights. The service we have received has been good every time! Overall, definitely a place to check out and one we won't hesitate to return to.

Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Hush Puppies.
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Crab Cake.

_kaWfqbb3ZVWkx2jZD90Jw.text: I love coming here for lunch. Dinner is great also, I just live to far away.  Been coming here since 1994!  I lunch here once a week usually.  I have to drive in from Maricopa now!

nHch0-pGCrQ-0QIxhRz7sw.text: Always good flavor and excellent service. I tried the sampler appetizer and it was ok. Found out I didn't like oysters but that's not their fault, lol. My go to favorites are Lulu's wing and crawfish gumbo and they never disappoint. I drive from Dysart in Goodyear to get their food and past another Cajun place on the way. Does that tell you how good the food is?

hNPH1wUV674bcuGqdOMNag.text: This is our second time coming here and the food is fantastic! My fiance and I enjoyed a half basket of husk puppies, a Cajun combo and some dirty rice! Couldn't go to wrong!

_08XGFIDzn4xv9ZfdBzGpg.text: We stumbled in here by accident, but as Bob Ross says, "there are no mistakes, only happy little accidents". I haven't had much experience other then the occasionally taste testing of a friend's jambalaya, but I throughly enjoyed this place.   I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo (lol not very Cajun-y) but it had a little "Cajun kick" to it. It was a huge bowl for only $10~ and I definitely had enough for leftovers. It was a tad spicy  and it was delicious!  Friends got the gumbo and jambalaya combos and they loved there food as well.  Bonus: they have our complimentary garlic bread!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Jambalaya
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo!

2yPVL_jd0R67pinkvOCAxQ.text: The service was great! We came for a Saturday lunch, but would love to return to hear live music. The alligator was tasty but sparse. We ordered the sampler appetizer- The oysters were tender and juicy. The catfish and shrimp had a nice breading. All of the sampler was tasty. The dishes were very heavy on fries. We preferred the sweet potato fries over the regular ones. We enjoyed all the food, but did think it was a little pricey.

neQ75rbqIHYk5nZHOaQZ2g.text: Awesome Cajun food spot. Didn't know what to ordered so went to the Cajun combo. It was really good. Accompanied by Louisiana beer it was perfect!   A blues guitarist was playing music which made the vibe event better.

98QjtR7YLExlTMmQjt459Q.text: If you were going to reheat my 20$ etouffee, at least it should be hot, not lukewarm...   My fiance and I came in the knowing the price would be moderate-high. However, we were not expected to pay 40$ meals on old, reheated food and burned garlic breads... seriously my breads were burnt on one side and soggy on the other side lol. And the food was so disappointed my fiance jokingly said the burnt breads was the best part of the meal haha.   In addition to it, the coleslaw was a bit weird and the potato salad wasn't even as good as safeway's   I added a star for the nice server we had. However, it would be a 2 stars.   It s our second time and would be our last.

cTltvWwdPDTFdZmORVYmdg.text: Very good fried shrimp and catfish. Chips and hush puppies were not my favorite. Friendly service.

GRstXBoLgbFmyR7--8Rnxg.text: Always glad when I am on the east side so I can have dinner at Baby Kay's. Amazing as usual...  great atmosphere and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

wRd_hdXabBg0wnZ9Yt5fDQ.text: My daughter and I were in the neighborhood and I saw that this was a restaurant I'd bookmarked.  We decided to check it out and we were absolutely not disappointed! In fact, I drug my husband back the next evening for dinner so that I could give it a second try and see if it was as good.  Firstly, the server Dustin was awesome and assured me I couldn't go wrong with any of the choices.  He was correct.  We tried a crab cake, seafood gumbo, and crawfish etouffee. Being from the NW, I prefer a little less kick (Old Bay spice?) to my crab cakes but for happy hour price, you get a good sized cake!  The gumbo had amazing flavor and was chock full of seafood.  I have to admit, most of the other times I've had gumbo, it was thicker and less soup-like. This has more of a broth but we realllllllllly enjoyed it.  The winner though is the crawfish etouffee.  It's Arizona.  It's finally not hot as balls and you can start to eat what I call "Fall Food." The etouffee is the ultimate comfort Fall Food.  My daughter said she could eat it all day; every day.  The next evening, my husband and I went and this time, I tried a half of a shrimp Po Boy along with a cup of crawfish etouffee (yes, I had to have it again.)  I didn't snap a picture of it but the batter was crisp and light.. more of a cornmeal-esque batter... but they perfect.  Not rubbery or overly cooked.  I could eat a basket of shrimp and etouffee and be a very happy gal.  We also tried the dirty rice.  I had never had it so I have nothing to compare it to.  My husband loved it.  I liked it alright but if I had to venture a guess, it's probably better than anybody else's.  Topping it all off with a hurricane while sitting outside watching the sun set over palm trees.  Now, that's a perfect Arizona evening! We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Seafood gumbo, Crab Cake, and Crawfish Etouffee.

m1bKH4Hvsoeuln4lHC1Qqg.text: Baby Kay's is one of my favorite restaurants and I'm glad that it's close to home. It's been a "reward" after a good dental checkup for a few years now (my dentist is across the street, next to Macayo's, but crunchy chips won't do after a cleaning), and I've celebrated a few birthday/special occasion dinners here. Pleasant atmosphere, a busy bar, and an outdoor seating area make this cozy strip mall location shine. I've enjoyed the wings, fried catfish, gumbo, and many appetizers at Happy Hour, but my favorite is the crawfish etoufee. Rich and hearty, with just the right amount of heat, served with toasted bread and (my choice) green olive cole slaw. Tastes great with a cold Abita, spicy Bloody Mary, or a strong Hurricane (or all three. Did I mention Happy Hour?). Come check it out!

jZ04PcHvNn_ZuqrFvgHq0g.text: I wish pleasantly surprised by this place.  It's located around storefronts, so I'm like .  When we went in and I saw alot of people on a Monday...I'm like yeah this might turn out great and it did.  They were short staffed, but everyone worked together as a team and the food was DELICIOUS!  You must try the Hurricane shrimp and the catfish was amazing as well.  I'll be back.

Tmsjiy8STWr6HFTt9ZyKag.text: Word of mouth has lead me to many great dining establishments all over the valley. Tonight, I got to share one of those discoveries with my oldest son. A former co-worker introduced me to Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen a little over a year ago. Since then, I've been back a few times to enjoy the authentic Creole cuisine.  Like me, my son has an adventurous interest in food, so I knew he would enjoy something different for dinner. We started with the Baby Kay's Sampler. This was a huge portion of deep fried goodness! It includes fries, fried oysters, fried shrimp, hush puppies, jalapeno poppers and fried catfish. Awesome variety! And considering it's a fried appetizer, you can still taste the quality of the product.  My son made a great selection for his entree. He loved (and devoured) his Pulled Pork Po' Boy. I told him it would be stuffed. And he wasn't disappointed. I've enjoyed a Po' Boy on occasion here.  I chose the daily special (Seafood Enchiladas) which our server Andrea described perfectly. She did a really amazing job too and even my son realized that her service was spot on. My enchiladas (more like mini burritos) were stuffed with shrimp and crawfish etouffee, served over dirty rice and smothered in a tequila cheese sauce. Oh my goodness! I cannot even begin to describe the flavor. And the portion was huge!  Besides great service, great atmosphere, great food and great company, what made me happy was hearing my son say he was going to have to tell his friends about Baby Kay's. Word of mouth. Pass it on!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. A generous portion of the daily special Seafood Enchiladas
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Baby Kay&#39;s Sampler. A great appetizer!

GmaDU9jcmfzHjuIU94SHDw.text: Made my second visit to Baby Kay's. I was just as pleased as the first time.  Tried the lulu wings and they were amazing,  bursting with flavor.  I also got a combo this time trying 3 of the Cajun staples,  jambalaya, etoufee, and gumbo.  I really liked all three and glad they were distinct in their own way.  I like the potato salad more than the coleslaw, I was expecting a more zingy flavor with the green olives.. my boyfriend likes the seafood basket with oysters and catfish. He ordered it again with the dirty rice which was flavorful as well.    Definitely suggest getting the pain killer, be careful it can be a sneaky one.   Service was great both times.  The waitress we had last night was vey helpful and patience that goes a long way in my book.    I guess po' boys will be next and of course an order of lulu wings ( I think I'm hooked)

GsEwxNqhQws8T6IaIZdemQ.text: Went here before a Blues Concert at Mesa Arts Center. There was a man playing the Blues. Music great, Food great. Loved the Atmosphere. Will totally repeat to try more foods from the menu. It was busy and fun.

TvmJUP92QlsTZ-JW7O54bA.text: Great place! Excellent service. When I told the server it was our first time he immediately offered us samples of their most popular dishes - now that's good service!   The reviews about the etouffee are True. It is slammin and I ate about half of my husband's plate! I got their BBQ shrimp and it was good but the sauce was unique and definitely not your typically BBQ sauce so just go into it knowing that. Great portions.  Side salad was excellent. Wasn't a huge fan of the green olive coleslaw but I had to try it because I've never heard of those flavors put together. Garlic was amazing!   My biggest reason for giving them 4 instead of 5 stars is kinda petty- they don't have beignets!! And that is so very Cajun and New Orleans. Our server said he had multiple requests for them in the past week so hopefully they start making them soon! If they do, I'll change my review to 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Daily and happy hour specials
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Free samples of their most popular dishes!

0_Ssck71FHx-t7n8lQu7GQ.text: Food and service were both great! Went there for the first time today for lunch. I couldn't decide what to order and was asking questions about a few different dishes, then the waitress ran back into the kitchen and actually brought me a sample of all three things I was considering. I can't say I've had that experience before at a restaurant and it definitely made this place stand out for quality service. The food was delicious and we had a great time.

XwMW5vc9s8ORKR6WiwB8Ow.text: This was our first time here and I am absolutely going to come back! Great food, jambalaya and etouffee OMG! Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for Cajun food! A must visit and the Bloody Mary wasn't bad either!

7GnIak0Vf4WYRzhIOVO3RQ.text: Wow!!  Very impressed and stoked to have found great cajun food out in the east valley!  Their lulu wings were the best I've ever had and the fried catfish with crawfish etouffee was also amazing. My wife got the gumbo which was great as well. We'll definitely be coming back!  By the way, the service was also perfect!  Everyone made us feel welcome and it had a great family feel to it.

mRfc1hjqaCCwsY_rDocu4g.text: Base on the reviews this place has received my wife and I thought we would give it a try. Wow they have the best gumbo I have eaten in years. Loved the place, the food and atmosphere were fantastic. We went for lunch and tried the combo appetizer plate to start. She had a catfish poor boy and I had the seafood gumbo.  Can't wait to go back.

r_dN8mqRN6l1-KQW8c_gVw.text: December 21st I was leaving a late appointment near here and my boyfriend and I were starving.  We did a quick google search and found this restaurant.  Although it was closing within 30 minutes we decided to stop in anyways.  We eat quickly and knew we would be done before closing, as we did not want to be "those" people.  In addition, my boyfriend loves cajun and I had always wanted to try this restaurant.  When we walked in the door there were a few other tables with people still eating and we were quickly seated and reminded that they were closing soon.  I didn't feel they were rude in any way but I am sure they were a little irritated by people who come in this close to closing, and I don't blame them.  Our waiter approached and quickly got us our drinks and our food came shortly after we ordered it.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere had a definite family feel.  As we had anticipated, we finished before 9pm and there were still patrons in the restaurant eating and socializing.  Although we were the dreaded customers that came in right before close, I never felt rushed or treated poorly.  In fact, everyone seemed very friendly and the service was impeccable.  I can't believe I waited so long to try this place and I know it will be an added regular to our list.  Thanks again for your hospitality and friendly service when many restaurants would not have acted in the same manner.  You have customers for life.

5K0vrDR0KRy21hI1PACAVg.text: We just happened upon this wonderful little place. I believe it's in a newer location and we couldn't be happier. Every plate of food we had was traditional and tasty. The vegetarian etoufee was the biggest surprise with its creamy vegetable sauce over perfectly cooked rice. The jambalaya and gumbo choices were fabulous, especially the duck option. Food is a teeny bit spicy here so be prepared to grab a chilled Abita beer with dinner. Can't wait to get back!

9hUn35C344Iyf9sCXcixIg.text: Great time in Mesa.  Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.  Crawfish etouffee was fantastic.  Generous portions. Will be back next time I'm in town.

F_kGdZ-Pfb2yHnYpnKywtA.text: Had my wife & a friend in for her birthday last night.....Susan enjoyed her Seafood Enchilada so much, she is having again  it for breakfast today.....Thanx to Baby Kay's for making my wife's  day extra special !

BtXX74sEJ3EjpAsY4zyusQ.text: The crawfish etoufee is unparallel to any I've ever had. I will keep going back as long as they keep serving this dish. The wings are dynamite as well.

3DkVFFubXPwjmaS_tlyq9Q.text: The service here is awesome! I can honestly say that I'm not much of a Cajun person, but met some friends here (I've only had Cajun literally 3 times in my life).... and I was skeptical. However, once we walked in, the decor is fun, there was live music playing, and the service was absolutely stellar. I really enjoyed being there and the servers  were very helpful when assisting me making a food choice!

sPRVCG7OdiOcjKsAUlksGA.text: Best pork chops I've ever had in my life. Portions are impressive and the service is very good. We were there when there was live entertainment, jazz. Great little place. Wait staff wants to be there.  Fun Try the pork chops!!

PcAPQZfvBkevHj3KFwy8Uw.text: Spicy, tasty Cajun food with friendly, Southern atmosphere.   I came here with family for a birthday and arrived late to a tray of fried everything. I'm not a huge fan of fried food, so I immediately became concerned. That said, I ate some of everything, and it was all pretty tasty.  But the entrees are where it's at here. I had the Cajun Combination, which included jambalaya, crawfish etoufee, and gumbo. The jambalaya was decent. I tried the duck and andouille sausage gumbo, and the duck was really tender and tasty. The etoufee was the highlight of the trio. The crawfish was plentiful, and the sauce was tasty. Oh, and the vinaigrette option for the salad was excellent! There's a nice, spicy kick to most of the dishes. Just right for me (granted, I'm a bit of a pepper belly). I also tried a couple bites of the catfish dish with crawfish, and it was fantastic! The catfish was juicy and tender inside and crispy outside. Perfect!   There was some nice live music for part of the meal. The service was decent and friendly.   Great option for Cajun!

kwgX9WDE_DCf2R20ALkTqg.text: Very tasty Cajun food but they really needed a lunch menu. Portions were large and way too much food for a summer lunch.

4tDwMIw9iHRNgIX7LaHFiw.text: I travel to New Orleans once a year and of course the first thing I always miss is the food, I searched long and high for some good Cajun and Creole food in the valley and stumbled across this gem...I absolutely love Baby Kay's Restaurant, every time I have visited their establishment I've received nothing but friendly service and well cooked food... The only type of person I would not recommend this restaurant to is anyone who doesn't like spicy food.

lr06G7ZjhQe8fYBcT3g5cQ.text: Very good food.  Yum. Great device.  My favorite is crawfish ettoufee. My daughter loves the catfish with crawfish sauce. Tons of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

BF94_z3xG_Wtn5Qxov7MWg.text: I'm from Texas, and there's a lot of people from Louisiana who relocate and open up good eats. Therefore, I've had a good amount of delicious Cajun food. I was craving some here in Phoenix, so I thought I'd give Baby Kay's a try.  It's located in a shopping strip with a good amount of parking. The restaurant is big, simple in decor, and there are a couple of servers. I feel like they need at least one more person helping out in the dining room because service was very slow, although when she did stop by our table, she was very good.  We started with the hush puppies, which were a good portion size for the price, but the spices seemed to be lacking. I know hush puppies are usually a simple batter deep fried to perfection, but these were nothing to write home about.  Shrimp etouffee was pretty good. I like that the shrimp were fresh, not frozen, and that there were lots of them. Accompanying rice did not seem fresh, though. Chicken po-boy with BBQ sauce was very boring and not worth the price, but unfortunately that's to be expected of non-seafood dishes in seafood restaurants.  I think the spices were kind of lacking all around, and the service was slow. Prices were kind of high, but at least the seafood is fresh. It wasn't worth the drive for me. Don't think I'll be back.

qEP9AjzgsLuhMECBSLO7Ew.text: As a native of New Orleans, LA, born and raised in Uptown, this place right here is THE real deal. I ordered food here today for my fiance and I, and the food was spectacular.   We ordered the Cajun combo, two catfish poboys dressed, and bread pudding.  First, the Cajun combo: we substituted the gumbo for red beans and rice, and had the crawfish etouffee and jambalaya. ALL VERY GOOD! I felt like I was eating good home cooked food.  Next the catfish poboys: these were great, really enjoyed mine. The cheese was different than what I'm used to having on a poboy, but it was still good none the less.  Last, the bread pudding: loved it. Bread pudding is my favorite dessert- hands down. The whiskey sauce for the bread pudding came on the side; however, I opted to forgo putting it on the dessert because I don't like whiskey (and it had a strong whiskey taste), and the bread pudding was amazing without it!   Overall, the service was good, the lady at the bar was very friendly, the atmosphere felt like I was somewhere relaxing on magazine street- I felt like I was back in my hometown.  I can definitely say any feelings of being homesick, disappeared once I walked inside Baby Kay's, so I'll definitely be ordering from here/ dining here again, and I'll be recommending it to other people.

GSIku2N8wZA-f39UiIobJg.text: Great food, reminded me of my years in New Orleans. If you want authentic Cajun spiciness you need to ask for it, they tone down the spice for the Phoenix crowd. Very friendly, and very fresh!

hSaGHma7OvkEo_ZpPpRQbw.text: The food is amazing! I like the vibe in this place as well. My favorite was the Etouffee. The gumbo was yummy as well. We also ordered the sampler platter that they had and it was to die for! The staff was very friendly as well. We will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Love it!

SgyQd40VYPPKoH4tud1YPg.text: This place is amazing! I am soooo glad that I just moved moved down the road. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

h47wSRee1oXDax75hwoxYg.text: As a huge fan of New Orleans, Baby Kay's really made me feel like I was in N'awlins.  The jambalaya, hush puppies, crawfish etouffee ... and yes folks, even the hurricanes! ... were out of this world.  Happy hour every day from 2 pm to 6 pm, and they have food AND drink specials.  Highly recommend trying to get there during happy hour since it's easy to get that bill up to a $100 for 2 :)

oKc9MdEc6p6cHRKCtcDSRQ.text: Wanted something different for lunch, so I looked up Cajun food and discovered this place. We had a nice comfy booth, and I was very pleased to see they had real sweet tea (I was raised in South Carolina and sometimes miss having it at every restaurant). I had the combo with gumbo, jambalaya and the crawfish etoufee. They were all delicious. I don't care for tomatoes, and I thoroughly enjoyed these because none of them were tomato base. I even had a few leftovers to take home. My boyfriend had their Cajun Burger, which he said was very good, the only complaint being that the menu said it had your choice of cheese as well as some blue cheese crumbles, but the waiter didn't ask and it was served with no cheese. So if you go and order that you might want to ask for the "cheeseburger"? Otherwise all was well, and I was totally digging the blues music.

R-L32fV-_gkJjoO4dnHWsg.text: I had the gumbo and jambalaya combo and it came with a salad.  The house dressing is very good and there is subtle heat in the gumbo and jambalaya that sneaks up on you.  The fiance had the pulled pork po boy.  That was porky gold!!  Awsome flavor and tender as the day is long.    Good blues playing in the background make this a cozy place for lunch or dinner.

6HGjGk9moC-g5Y-KOZlVYw.text: We went to this place based on reviews. I am highly upset the food and customer service. It took at least 15 minutes to get drinks.  When they brought out my fiance  wings he thought they were the breaded ones (it's our first time there) we were told "well why didn't you order the other ones" I found that so rude and disrespectful.  Horrible customer services.  We askes for the other wings were told they would be brought out.... never where. Our sides were cold and catfish was salty!! Let's not mention they never brought out my fiance poptato salad until I mentioned it when i was paying. I will for sure never go back there, defienty not after the customer service.

JDxIdC6d9aC1qoATu97Z6w.text: We loved going to this place when it was still at town and country. Didn't realize it was so close to our home! Food is great! Had one of the combos and it was worth while! Talk about trifecta -- gumbo, jambalaya, and etouffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

8PcojmudeYgWJbFsBaiPog.text: This review is based on one visit at 2pm in the afternoon, so maybe not the best time of day for top notch food. Was in the area and had been wanting to try this place based on other reviews. Ordered a cup of seafood gumbo that was priced at $6.50 for happy hour and a oyster Po'Boy sandwich which was about $13. Received a small cup of gumbo with several tiny pieces of shrimp. The flavor and heat level were good but way overpriced and disappointing overall. My wife's chicken and sausage gumbo at least had lots of meat. Po'Boy was equally disappointing and overpriced. Came out not assembled so you had to do that yourself. Bun was cheap light weight bun probably store bought. The sandwich included about 6 or 7 tiny oysters, one tomato sliced in half, couple pickles and some shredded lettuce. The sandwich itself was only about 7 inches. I could hardly taste the oysters for the thick cheap bread. If you want a good Po'Boy try "Flavors of Louisiana". Their Po'Boy is outstanding.

fcVxwjOA7Ub3Xjay_2dQyA.text: Best Cajun food this side of New Orleans!  Rivals even Bourbon Street. I'll definitely be going back.

SU5ysIaJqqvElBOmmQHZvA.text: Baby Kay's is still the best Cajun food in the Valley. My husband is from NOLA so we have credibility! :)  I worry about them staying in business because their Mesa location is terrible. They are worth driving for. Truly! I love Baby Kay's combo with chicken and sausage gumbo, red beans and rice, and green olive coleslaw. So freaking good! Love the crawfish etouffee enchiladas for lunch on Tuesdays. The patio is dog friendly. And they often have live music which takes you out of Phoenix and straight to Bourbon Street.

hzBeYGe3nKa49cFFa6hNdQ.text: Since moving to the Valley this has become my favorite restaurant. Great Sea Food gumbo. First time I have ever had alligator and loved it.

r1Ms5ImbFlPOZCRm111m6g.text: The service that I received from Kayla is 5 star however everything else was not worth much. If you come by yourself they seat you way in the back behind everyone else where you can't even see the live music (oh the music was good). I kept wishing someone from the big group directly in front of me would go to the bathroom so that I could see. Then the extremely extremely disappointing food. The Gumbo taste okay however it had an odd taste and a bunch of overcooked crawfish that was the best thing that I had and it was not all that great. The barbecue shrimp should be called Worcestershire sauce and overcooked shrimp. All I taste was Worcestshire sauce they should take that trash off of the menu. My garlic bread was burnt, the wings were just ok. The sweet tea was the best thing that I had.

Dukal0ItpM5Sz3nivwq5lA.text: Delicious and large portions.   I had the dirty rice and crawfish etouffee.  My husband had the catfish and my daughter had the jambalaya.  None of us could finish our dinners but they were all excellent.

joXA6_GKNQkKtETA2r1GIw.text: I can't wait to go back for more! We decided to try a few things: bbq shrimp on happy hour, which has a spicy Worcestershire sauce, seafood gumbo, alligator and clam basket, and the vegetable ettoufee. The ettoufee was creamy without being too rich. Perfectly spiced and veggies were not overcooked. The seafood gumbo was light on spices, which let the natural sweetness of the seafood come thru. We also had hushpuppies which came with a creamy horseradish sauce. Again, not too spicy which allows the flavors to come together. I really loved everything. The dirty rice was salted just enough. We didn't want to give up the plate with the bbq sauce, we were dipping our bread in it. So good! I was very impressed with the alligator. I haven't had any this good for 15+ years. Cooked perfectly, using tender pieces of meat and a delicate batter.  Lastly, the olive cole slaw. They really put extra love into the dishes. You can tell when you taste the food.  Waitress provided excellent service and I would recommend this place 100%. I know I'll be back. Try this restaurant!

ncqSRkH4nqB1QepRYnfS5w.text: Outstanding seafood gumbo and green olive coleslaw. Have had the seafood enchiladas as well.. excellent cajun choice.

dezm2n_vl2J3XbTs53zCTQ.text: I was super excited to try out this restaurant because the reviews seem to be very strong but needless to say I was a bit disappointed.    The service was OK ( our waitress could have been a little bit more personable) . She did her job but definitely was not as welcoming or outgoing as I was expecting   The  food was not as good as I was hoping for after reading the reviews  ( the garlic bread served with our appetizer and meal was definitely old and stale  ( I swear it must have been frozen and microwaved ) . I did like the crawfish etouffee but felt like the gumbo was very watery and the jambalaya I ordered was mainly white rice .... All in all - I felt my experience and  the food was not as outstanding as i had hoped.

OeTN27_VnzV50RyJXYR6Pg.text: I love this little place. Super Friendly staff in a great location. I was even drawn in by the clientele; I encountered several regulars as I waited for my order. All raved about the food and recommended several dishes. Well this was my cheat day and what better food to cheat with...fried. I tried the catfish and shrimp. It was just ok. There wasn't much fish to the fish, more batter. The shrimp was only slightly better. Could have been seasoned a bit better so on my next visit, I'll be trying something different.

L0PJXAVdQbX70hzT9I6Ocg.text: We love this place. The service is always fantastic and the food is just incredible.This restaurant hands down has the best crawfish etouffee. We also enjoy the Lulu wings. We have not ventured to try any other dishes, but the table next to us got the catfish and it looked oh so yummy.

___OqkMuxOVUnjo-Vl4j7Q.text: Tried this place out for the fried catfish and tried the crawfish etouffe.   The food was amazing it was the best catfish I had since moving from Texas!!!!

cB4x7XYc3DDB91Q6eMRifw.text: Decided to check this place out finally and was well worth the trip.  Traveled from Ahwatukee, which nothing is really that far but for food sometimes its not worth it.  Either way, after reading other yelpers reviews and seeing the pics for HH everyday from 2-5 figured a Saturday afternoon trip over after some shopping sounded like a plan.  As most places, a strip mall restaurant doesn't look like much on the outside.  Dark windows because of sun and a small patio but too hot to sit outside still.  First impressions was good.  Nothing spectacular for decor. Tables are well placed apart from each other, a few booths, a great use of chalkboard for specials, and a decent bar but not over stated.  Wait to be seated, which wasn't crowded so about 2 minutes before a waiter came to seat us.  Menu is simple which was where I got hopeful they actually specialize in what they cook instead of some of these places who have too many selections that all taste the same.  We ordered 1 item from the starters and that was the fritters. They were pretty darn good.  Didn't taste the oil, good corn bread mixture, could have incorporated actual corn to make them better but they served with a horseradish deep that was fantastic.  From the HH menu, we selected: Hurricane shrimp, Crab Cake, Duck and Andouile gumbo, Seafood gumbo, Crawfish etouffee, BBQ pork sliders and LuLu's wings. I've posted pics as well but here's my take - Shrimp were fantastic, 6 shrimp swimming in their honey hot sauce with a scoop of white rice in the middle.  My BF could have licked the plate.  Sauce provided heat but not where you can't taste anything else.  Crab Cake they slipped on the sage and it tasted like thanksgiving stuffing.  Not much crab so I'd pass on that one when I go back.  Gumbos were amazing!  This is where they have concentrated their efforts and KUDO's to them!  Seafood gumbo was a tad better than the duck/sausage from a fat content.  They were both prepared perfectly.  The Crawfish Etouffee was rich and flavorful and bursting with crawfish.  A must try as well.  LuLu's wings were deep fried and then sauced with the Hurricane sauce but not so great IMO.  They turned out a bit too sweet for my tastes.  But based on the consistency of the batter on the wing I bet their fried chicken is good.  The wings were a nice size but again, too sweet for me. And last but not least the pork sliders.  Great amount of pork on each slider, sauced with very well could have been the Hurricane sauce - was sweet, tangy not spicy BBQ flavor. Could taste a hint of smoked flavoring but definitely not smoked. Not a BBQ joint however so will let those slide.  My Rating - Gumbos: outstanding, Etouffee: outstanding, Hurricane Shrimp: Very Good; Fritters: Pretty good,  CrabCake:  Not so Good; Wings: Okay; BBQ Pork Sliders: Pass  Definately will be going back to try some other items on their menu!  Hope this helped someone!

wOGo6j3e1DGplqn5SJirTA.text: Their food was all the same. Hot cayenne pepper. No depth of flavor or skills. Deep fried hot food.  If that sounds like you, you will love this place.  Even their cole slaw was pepper laden. My son who loves it all hot voted never to return. Just no flavor to go with the pepper. So sad. I love southern food.

lf9pXFaSBarNdi124z9wKg.text: came here for the second time last night and it was great!! i was pretty bummed the performer left as we walked in but it's all good (fri night at 8:30 pm) cuz the first time we were there, we got to enjoy the blues performer! i was sick all day and the only things that sounded good were a bloody mary and pasta (super weird lol) but our server ricki said their bloody marys were pretty spicy but really good! after i squeezed the lime in there, it was perfect! glad i went with her recommendation! i had the veggie fettuccine which was BOMB. but again, i was sick so only ate a few bites.. rickis team member asked if she could box it up for me so i said yes and thanked her. i didn't think she heard me when i said, "it's really good, i just don't feel well"-- which was no big deal! but i took it out of the fridge to have for brunch today and there was a little note that said, "feel better :)" on my box. it's the little things like that that make restaurants to the top of my list! ricki, thank you to you and your team member and to our server we had the first time (it was back in may but i can't remember his name)! amazing customer service from beginning to end! we'll be back for sure!

5nb_ckSMC8qgc-cCtdfccQ.text: I'm not a NOLA native,  but my father is, and mother lived there for 8 years. My father moved back to NOLA in 2010 and I've been to visit maybe once or twice a year ever since. Each time I return home, I yearn for the food back in NOLA. Enter Baby Kay's- The best you're gonna get in AZ. Not everything is perfect, but the service is on point (Kyle was attentive and friendly) and the food and atmosphere brings me to the place I want to be. Very worth it!

72Vg3bFy2Fy5ixfHCyMrzw.text: Food is off da fuckin chain. Straight . The seafood gumbo is puff. The seafood etoufee is crack. And the jambalaya is straight too. Damien is on point as a server. Speedy, polite and made great suggestions.   I'll be back soon.

YXA5V_h12bHC8HE9Yoqegg.text: Would've been 4 stars for the food--loved our duck gumbo, crawfish etouffee and crab cake. (Bread pudding was just ok.) But the service was exceedingly slow and after taking our order for happy-hour pricing, the waitress informed us (half-hour later, after forgetting our crab cake order), that we had actually ordered too late for happy-hour!  Not cool. Should've asked for the manager, but we were running late for another engagement.

VjV0oGqwasZlNMPSge1TrA.text: Decided to have dinner here for our 50th anniversary and we weren't disappointed! Just moved to Mesa, AZ six days ago and we are not real familiar with all the restaurants. So we turned to Yelp for guidance. And this time you hit it out of the ballpark with Baby Kay's! We have spent time in Cajun country of LA and were very surprised to find a Cajun restaurant right here in Mesa! The menu was on point and the seasoning of the dishes was just about perfect! Hubs had the fettuccine with shrimp and andouille sausage and he said it was delicious and the side was red beansand rice. And they were spot on! I ordered the catfish and also selected red beans and rice as my side. One twist (for us) was the offering of either courtboullion or etouffee for the fish. I ordered the etouffee. I could have it on the side or over the fish. I had it on the side but it would have been yummy on top. The catfish was some of the best I've ever had. Crisp coating but not heavy. And the fish was moist! Only disappointment was we were stuffed and didn't have room for the bread pudding with the whiskey sauce but we had really overdone the carbs so we will have to go back another time for that!

yuWp-XPtVU6gwGY57L2-OQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Tempe area, especially when I want to walk out of my comfort zone and try something special. This is the first place for me to have Cajun food, all the names of which I have been hearing about on MasterChef but never tried them. My husband and I have been there twice, and the dishes we tried (almost all of their popular dishes) were absolutely delicious. I like the live music they have in the restaurant as well!!

0335Dpt7OXUOIjVo1unHFw.text: This is a great place for spicy Cajun for?  The PoBoys are delicious and so is the jambalaya. Our server, Val, did a great job of keeping up with our requests and sodas. The menu is quite diverse, with that Loosianna focus. The decor shows typical Cajun and Mardigras themes. Prices were reasonable, averaging $10-$12 pretty much. There is a full bar, if that suits your fancy. They do have a Happy Hour menu, too. Fun place, especially for lunch.

JEd6pwB8A7qmLQkJ2xWd3A.text: the Pork Chop on the weekends is the star. This is a fav of the whole valley area for me. With all the gravy AND fruit cocktail (hard core ol skool) it is always the perfect bite. I have no idea have those two work I jus know that they do. I have had the cole slaw, potato salad ,dirty rice and red beans & rice and I do recommend those. The cole slaw is great if you like green olives. During the week it's the etouffee w/dirty rice unless it's Monday. Then, u know....

56lLP4qTlO56Bao88oetZQ.text: I came in right as they opened on a Tuesday for lunch. We ordered the Boudin Balls which are a Cajun sausage served with apricot-pepper jelly and garlic bread. Oh my! These were to die for! They had the perfect amount of spice and kick mixed in with a sweet jelly. Mix those two with the garlic bread and you're set! I would definitely recommend those. I also ordered the fish basket (catfish and shrimp). Both fish are fried and come with your choice of a side. I got fries. The horseradish sauce is potent, so be careful! Service was quick and friendly. All in all a good experience.

Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

wHpQXf0s8UGmEZ5EX1dF0g.text: Baby K's is a good little Cajun joint off of Dobson Rd in Mesa. Nice ambience, live music, smiling servers and very good food makes the place definitely one of the best representatives of southern food in the east valley.  I tried the fried chicken special on Thursday night and it was excellent. Huge portions, moist breast meat, crispy chicken skin, lots of spices including perfect helpings of cayenne on the chicken made the dinner great. The dirty rice is a perfect side. I also tried the gumbo and jambalaya from a friend's plate and they were very tasty as well.  Definitely a place to check out if you like southern comfort food.

qYLoKXYpahiiQbklhPVnqw.text: My hubby and I love Cajun food, especially Etouffee. We have been going to another Cajun restaurant for our etouffee fix for years and since we moved to Mesa we decided to give this a try. First of all, they have a great happy hour specials. We ordered the crawfish etouffe and the fried shrimp appetizer from the menu. WOW WOW!! We truly did enjoy each of the entrees. There is a reason why this restaurant still attracts great clientele. We will definitely be coming back for more of our Cajun fix. Thank you Baby Kay's!

NuYC9htNVZ6-jx2t4NVSkQ.text: Enjoyed some of the best Cajun food I've had since visiting New Orleans. I ordered the combo which included the gumbo, etouffee, and jambalaya. All were fantastic! Also there was an older black gentleman there playing blues guitar which really added to the overall ambience. I highly recommend this outstanding restaurant!

lHuVcOnLXih3yGpCH3A5cQ.text: I've been to Baby Kay's twice in the last five years. It is good. It's not great. Today I got an oyster po-boy with fries. The oysters were great. I got a to go order and I appreciated that the sandwich wasn't full assembled so it wouldn't get soggy. That said, even after I put it together it lacked that drip-down-your-arm goodness I expect from a po-boy. The bread wasn't crusty--it was very soft. The remoulade was very heavy on the horseradish.  I like lettuce, tomato, and pickles on a po-boy. My sandwich only came with two little tomato slices. I did find the pickles hiding under my fries after I was done with my sandwich. They were really tasty--wish I had found them sooner. The fries were crispy and had Cajun seasoning. The oysters were good enough, I'll come back but I'd probably get the platter and not the po-boy.

nFIll_0yQaWYf3NECm2ALA.text: This place is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix Arizona it is definitely a touch of Louisiana great food great people great atmosphere all around a wonderful place to eat and enjoy yourself

pFOyOy3OVrRQx1JLB-OGBA.text: Best Cajun food in town. It is a little pricy but you get what you pay for. I love the Crawfish Etouffee with fried shrimp but everything is great.

xqnVUIzk6wmB_MyszIO3tg.text: Love the Live Music! Love the Atmosphere!  Love how the soft drinks are served (in a carafe). Love the ambiance! Really liked the Crab Cake appetizer ... Really liked .. not loved.  I'm from Maryland so I'm a little biased  LOVED the catfish dinner with crawfish sauce .. Man that was damn good! Loved the side salad and ranch that accompanied my entree. LOVED the garlic bread that also accompanied my meal.  The portions are HUGE!  More than enough for dinner and leftovers.  I've been in Arizona for 4 years.  I love Cajun food.  I have no idea why it took me so long to try it.  One thing's for certain, it won't take me so long to go back.    Exceptional service!  I noticed there were LOTS of regulars dining there.  Some of the guest knew the servers by name and vice versa.  That was nice to see. I don't know if they have live music every night but they do for sure on Saturdays.  I must return soon!

kK87wwTYdjWHi5NIrJUzGw.text: Being from a French Cajun family and growing up in Slidell, La, I was happy to come across this place. There's definitely a shortage of Louisiana inspired home cookin'. It definitely had a Nawlins  feel to the decor but was slightly lacking in that southern hospitality kind of attitude by the servers. The roux used in the gumbo watery and the chef  attempted to compensate with heat. Still, it was a reminder of home with this restaurants attempt and I give them a thumbs up. Maybe not two but every business has to start somewhere. Ill definitely try this place again down the road.

kgkjOAEVvvJr9iDo5e1QQQ.text: This restaurant has become a favorite of the whole family. I have been there at least 3 times and have always been happy with the service, food and atmosphere. The drinks I have had are excellent although strong. My adult son chose this place for his birthday celebration. Its fare is unique and reasonably priced. I look forward to returning again.

UozGpXVklJWB-MBN_DQT0A.text: This place is amazing!!! The catfish didn't taste "fishy". The crawfish was insanely incredible. The Lulu wings are cooked so crispy and perfect! I've lived across the street for 5 years and finally stopped in to try it! I'm so glad I did!  If you're looking for some True authentic Cajun food this place is a must! And our server Morgan was incredibly helpful with suggestions and extremely cool and polite.   coming back for Thursday night fried chicken!!

eLmsIdsv7kl1EKiB-KnF1w.text: When I first get to the establishment it had a great Theme, plenty of pictures on the wall and I went on a Saturday night there was a guy there playing the Blues..... Great Deal. For DinnerI had the Catfish Dinner, Red Beans and Rice, Gumbo, Crawfish Etoufee & Dirty Rice  and of course a Hurricane  Catfish had a great Crust on it, but it wasn't cooked all the way.... just the Crust inside the fish needed a little more attention. Red Beans and Rice was a real miss. I suggest go to NOLA and do some Samples.... Order some Camelia's and try again.  Gumbo was OK... nothing to write home about but it was do-able Etoufee was very good. I could go back and get me a big bowl of that. The Hurricane Drink was good... a little different from NOLA version but a good version.  I gave it 3 stars only because I know what real Creole food should taste like and I personally feel it's priced a little too high...  I do suggest going it's worth the trip and the meals are all do-able and the atmosphere is a good one. Service and was awesome too.

mZyjXx5ExoiJ9vugMzpw-Q.text: I've been going here for 25 years they were at 20th and Camelback, they had to close so I lost them for almost a year, then one day I'm driving down Dobson road and there it is. I made a uturn went in and was pleased to see that the twins who owned it still do, the food is fantastic, pricy but worth the money. If you like CAJUN, this place is for you.

Q9Lt1Zl7YDnafuPQR7zdcA.text: My first experience with Cajun food and it was so worth it, waitress brought me samples before ordering, such a rarity these days, actual customer service . Food and flavor was phenomenal and the waitresses are on it. Definitely worth a return

qH3U232CnpbuILeyTB5uZw.text: Just an update for carry out dinners....my husband has been working out of town so I've been ordering for take home lately (I'm uncomfortable eating out alone..just me) every item has been just as delicious and packed perfectly. They always ask about cutlery, which I appreciate because I don't use it and hate throwing it out. They sell mason jars of their Blue Cheese dressing now!!!(there was smiley and dancing lady emojis inserted here, they don't show, just know they were there!! Hahahaha)

EMEn1NE5v-9jwBW-B737yQ.text: Fantastic place to grab some tasty jambalaya, etouffee, and gumbo.  Service was great and the food came out quick.  Expect to pay around 20 bucks for a meal, but well worth it in my opinion.

EfezIriZExkWEiqRVMnC5A.text: Really enjoyed the Cajun food. If you're looking for an authentic place this is where you need to go. Even have live music.

KEhxQKyIf5nr9-tpUe79Gw.text: Always great food!  Definitely a place to come when you need something beyond the ordinary fare you'll find at a local bar.  The hush puppies are great and the catfish out of this world.  I echo another reviewers comments and wish they would add beignets - that would be the icing on the cake.

9xRFwFOsg5ei9jiEveVAjg.text: I'M UPSET! Baby Kay's: WHERE do you get off serving gumbo that damn good?? How dare you. And the green olive cole slaw? You're just showing off. And then you have the nerve to play classic New Orleans music while I stuff my face, coming up for air strictly for survival purposes.  And the bread pudding with the whiskey sauce?? My granny made bread pudding that I thought was the best in the world. Now I'm mad as hell at her. And she can't even defend herself, because she's dead.  My whole world is shaken right now. In the best way possible. Kudos, Baby Kay. I love you.
