ITy9m9AoO3gZ5JCviGniag.text: Been coming over 8 years! Never disappointing! Love the staff! Love the Serena Combo!!!!!! Always a comfort to come here and you have to have the Bourbon Sundae!!!!

-5aeLYK3_bzT1YHuSeNHtQ.text: Food okay.  Not great.  Waiting area to be seated not okay.  We were told to wait on a bench positioned at the hallway next to the restrooms.  Not exactly good for the appetite.  We waited there 15 minutes before being seated.    We watched other patrons come in and be seated.  I finally approached the hostess and she said she forgot we were there. Really?  The manager walked by numerous times, but did not ask us if we wanted a drink while we were waiting.  Why have the waiting area in a place undesirable and out of the hostess view?  The waiter was not familiar with the menu.  We ordered and were not given what he described was the item after finally getting our food.  He did not bring the entire order.  Forgot the fries.  I asked for ketchup for the now cold fries.  Not got it. We wanted a refill on our drink order that took too long the first time.  We finally had another server bring us 2 more beers.  Really sad experience.  We will not be back.

AUmE5omC8fcEZzWseYDMfA.text: I've been going to Baby Kay's since it was at its old location by the Biltmore. Everyone is always so friendly and inviting. I've never had bad service. And of course the food is amazing. My favorite is crawfish etouffe with the dirty rice. And of course the green olive coleslaw is the best! I recommend the 3 combo with the etouffe, jambalaya, and gumbo. You get a little bit of everything in one meal. It's absolutely perfect!! All in all, great location, great food, and a great experience every time I go there.

oE2LSS5RxBOnp1VByz1c0w.text: Been feasting at Town & Country Baby Kay's for 10 years - this location offers the same amazing quality Cajun food at great prices.  Quality of Food   The Etouffee = 10 Catfish Sandwich = 10 Chicken and Sausage gumbo = 10   this is the best Cajun food in the valley hands down eat here one time and you're done you're a regular for life - the food is that good

The specials board was covered in delicious sounding meals, some for dinner, some lunch, some both. I tried the combo so I could get the biggest sampling possible on my first visit and couldn't have been happier. The jambalaya, chicken and sausage gumbo, coleslaw and bread were all really good and the crawfish etouffee was phenomenal. I sat inside but they have a patio with umbrellas that looked pretty appealing. I'll be back for sure.

_FrtI-Okxw1WQi7WG07XCQ.text: Had lunch here yesterday! The food was really really good! Loved the ambiance of the restaurant it had the New Orleans vibe! I had the Lulus wings and the po boy and gumbo soooo yummy!!!!! We ordered the bread pudding it was okay I think the whiskey sauce was too strong for me personally. Other than that highly recommend!

Vr5P6lf3zcBQLgcsPt1Ing.text: My wife and I are long time patrons of Baby Kay's.  We were happy to see that they had reopened at last and had to visit.  We had Po'boy sandwiches (pork, half shrimp and half catfish), a crab cake and some gumbo.  The chicken and andouille sausage gumbo was as wonderful as ever.  The crab cakes was delightfully spicy.  The sandwiches wonderful with the same crunchy chips.  We also took home some Bread Pudding which was splendid as usual.    All in all a fantastic visit.

zUhQPZz0Tx_H_8pvrIo0qw.text: I've read reviews and thought I'd give it a try. For a place as well spoken of i found the service very lacking in customer service period. 9 people in there they were un-attentive to service at tables the bar received great service. Will not be returning.....   Food was very overwhelming as far as spice goes,   i realize Cajun food is spicy and I've had good Cajun food but what we were informed of the spice levels poorly.

ANREpQHsKrBANVpU3zjAWA.text: Great food, good atmosphere, friendly staff. I had the Shrimp Po' Boy, and it was terrific. The prices were good for the amount of food you get.

osoTHhvP6zgD0-QZ2J-Ycw.text: I like, no, LOVE this place. The food is amazing. Hush puppies are the best I have ever had. The shrimp etouffee is consistent and amazing. This place stands out because they are 'consistently' amazing.  Did I mention this place is amazing! Huge fan for over a year. They have never served me a bad meal. Thank you for awesome food.

U9jlXuKPyPouYncDlHSzfQ.text: Great Cajun place! Everything was really good overall. Good amount of spice. Boudin balls were tasty. Jambalaya was good but rice was just a little too soft. Gumbo and etouffee were both very good. Cute interior and they have a bar too which I wasn't expecting. We will be back.

DkXm7lejF_1eZ62QNJW8bA.text: I love cajun food. This place is the best I've found in the valley so far! Still not french quarter caliber but hey, we aren't there.  The flavors were great. The seafood gumbo and the crawfish etouffee was just the thing to give me my fix for that cajun craving! Way less work and mess than a boil like the kind at the Angry Crab. I felt like I got way more crawfish meat in the etouffee.  My husband got the fried combo basket with catfish, shrimp and clams. Light breading, very good. They know how to cook their shrimp here. I feel like they could skip the paper doilies though.  I love that they have vegetarian options too!

dPRpffPr3L_ontzA3eHL0Q.text: This place is aweaome!  You have to have some of their Crawfish ettouffe. It is one of the best tasting meals I've ever had. The place isn't cheap but is well worth it.

PWTCzi6GCWvL0tgdai5a-g.text: This place is just awesome. Come in for Louisiana beers I haven't seen anyplace else in town (namely Dixie), their combination platters never disappoint. Save room for their bread pudding!!!

x_6xVjcOJL1OCcoQiEhF2g.text: This is the best Cajun food in Phoenix. Best Etufee ever. Best wings called Lu Lu Wings.  Great Happy Hour.  Have been eating there for years. Yum

ehApTeZzGj9w8STONKk9VA.text: The ONLY place in Phoenix that satisfies this Cajun girl's taste for Louisiana! I was born and raised in South Louisiana, so I def know what gumbo and boudin should taste like! This place is so on point.  The atmosphere reminds me of one of the many neighborhood restaurants in Lafayette, LA.  You MUST TRY the boudin balls that are served with an apricot pepper jelly.   I drive all the way from downtown just to eat at Baby Ks!

XVwyerE-60_wvH8AGsnIdA.text: We went here for girls night and to celebrate my friend's birthday. I had the shrimp gumbo combo with the catfish po' boy. It was really good, my friend had the jambalaya and gumbo combo. The jambalaya was peppery bit still good. We ordered a chocolate cake to share berween 4 of us and it was decadent. It was also plenty big for all of us.  The second time I came here was within a month of the first time, because my husband loves alligator and its not easy to find. It was amazing! The breading was perfectly seasoned. Try the bourbon chocolate sundae!

f1jdWTlZAdY34k6-H03iNg.text: I enjoyed this restaurant very much. My first visit about a month ago and i svored those friend oysters. Loved them. The drinks were typical drinks. Service was great. I always have open expectations for food, taste and presentation so everything was great. The only thing I half expected was for the inside to be bigger and cleaner since we were all cramped in and there was no waiting area inside so people waiting are just crammed everywhere, watching you eat. That was what happened for my first visit. Otherwise  all was great

nVt-zzMjitVLfxhP80Avsw.text: Well, if you saw my last review of this place, I said we have tried almost everything on the menu except the burger.  Well, can't say that any longer.  Last Saturday my wife and I ate there to celebrate my birthday, what a great time.  Martin was the waiter and we were able to visit with one of the owners, Heather.  Well, we thought it might have been one of the owners, it might have been two of the owners, as Heather informed us that her twin sister also was a owner, but they had never pulled the twins game!  :-)    Anyway back to the burger, I have stayed away from it as blue cheese is not one of my favorite cheeses, but Martin recommended it so I trusted his recommendation.  So glad I did, it was outstanding, one of the best burgers I have had!!!!  Heather said it was her recipe so kudos for her for that.   I can say once again, love this place and it is one of our go to places in the Mesa, Dobson Ranch area.

a4pUQqzO_PLlDMwbJousnA.text: I called in and placed an order for pick up. We order Hush Puppies, 2 order of the Lulu wings and the crawfish etouffee.   Walked in to the bar because that's where they told me to pick up at. I sat down for a good 5-10 mins before I was even helped. This was a Friday night and an hour before closing. It wasn't that busy at all. There was three people behind the bar but none seem to notice me . Service issue?  Anyways I was really looking forward to trying the chicken wings. I saw pictures and it looked great. Supposedly the chicken were suppose to be sweet and spicy. It tasted like they over did it with the honey  because it wasn't spicy at all. The chicken tasted old like it's been in the freezer for months. It wasn't juicy at all and super dry.   The crawfish etouffee was the only thing I could eat. It was my first so I couldn't compare it to other places but it had a nice kick to it and the crawfish was nice and meaty I had some pretty huge chunks of meat in there.  That's all I got I had high hopes for this place but that chicken wing ruined it.

KC3TxSbCPR7YmNZ2kaHtkQ.text: The best Cajun food in Arizona. My favorite is the crawfish etouffee. No other place make it better than Baby Kay's.

lHegpGViNTz1KBosyjX4Vw.text: The cajan combo was good however our fried foods were all cold. We waited a while and others who were seated after us got their food first. The live music was a good vibe and pretty busy. I think if the food was more fresh i couldve given it 4-5 stars. I would say find an off day when not so busy to eat there.

Ptd82poiUgRmfaRRm-xJKQ.text: This place is too delicious!!!!  I've been here twice, and I get the three combo plate that comes with the ettouffe, jumbalaya, sausage gumbo or seafood gumbo and potato salad. I love the ettouffe, it's the reason I come here, and the jumbalaya. Everything was just really fantastic, the food and the service!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Three plate combo with potato salad, so good!!

aGOytNYDRMlU5eBCpm1P0Q.text: the food was delicious, the service was very friendly and prompt. the live music on friday night was amazing, and the atmosphere was very welcoming. cant wait to go back.

J1zcTsuwURLuUqiLGTESUQ.text: This place is great. The Etouffee is delicious, and the waitstaff is polite and prompt, I highly recommend!

7AkHauXrScEo4Bp7rMVCtg.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for some good gumbo around the valley and found baby Kay's on yelp. It was quite a drive for us coming from the west valley, but totally worth it! We had the chicken and sausage gumbo and pork po boy with sweet potato fries. The gumbo was well seasoned and had a great kick to it; both the chicken and sausage were tender. Po boy was delicious and so were the fries. Dessert looked absolutely delicious and massive, but we were way too full after dinner to try some! Will definitely have to save room next time. Portions were decently sized, especially if you're splitting two dishes it's more than enough to leave you feeling full and satisfied. We will be back soon!

3Ty_gFcH87soGuwcWxBGlQ.text: Came here for the 1st time last weekend with a party of 18 girlfriends and we had a truly fab dinner at Baby Kay's.  Firstly, the staff was wonderful and accommodating- a terrific bunch of people who provided great service to us.  Secondly, the music was great! There was an older gentleman playing some nice grooves on his guitar and we thoroughly enjoyed him!  As for the food? It was really good. I'm not well versed in Cajun food and this was really my first time eating it. I was impressed!  I had a hankering for fish that unfortunately had to go unsatisfied because the only fish they have on the menu here is catfish. Ugh. I am just not a fan of catfish at all! So instead, I ordered the shrimp po'boy sandwich with fries and a side of shrimp etoufee. I didn't eat the "sandwich" portion of the po'boy because they served it plain on a dry hoagie bun with only lettuce and tomato on the side. I'm trying to be "selective" with my carbs and it just wasn't appetizing enough for me to cheat. Instead, I ate the fried shrimp off the bun and found it to be delicious! Well-seasoned and cooked perfectly! The French fries were also very tasty. I hadn't ever eaten etoufee before, but I was pleasantly surprised! It was uniquely flavorful and scrumptious! I would have preferred more finely chopped onions (there were big onion hunks in this stuff), but other than that I really enjoyed it.  If Baby Kay's was closer to my neck of the woods, I'd be more likely to be a repeat customer because there were a lot of things on their menu I'd have loved to try. I'm not in the East Valley much but if I'm ever in the vicinity, Baby Kay's would be high on my list to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Crawfish etoufee with dirty rice
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Shrimp Po Boy with fries &amp; shrimp etoufee. So good!

FCOFxz_dqKKqu9gEUpNkDA.text: Have not been here in about a year+ because of the move n remove but I must say they are doing the same great quality food service and atmosphere out in Mesa. You have to come out and check this place out for authentic Cajun cuisine. Sooo many awesome dishes to choose from + an incredible happy hour everyday from 3 to 6 and Saturday 2 to 6. One of my favorites for sure is the crawfish etouffee and dirty rice. YUM. Heidi n Heather are FANTASTIC.  Come by n check it out for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Daily Specials
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Crawfish etouffee and dirty rice. #1 on my list.
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Dirty rice and they&#39;re awesome garlic bread. Amazing!

yERmj_JP0LRPLklSBRPk9g.text: My husband and I are Creole but born and raised in Cali. We are here visiting and I have come every night of our stay!! This place is truly authentic! The people are wonderful, sweet, down to earth, (especially James and Kathy who are locals and genuinely awesome), and they've made our stay in Arizona just a little more special!! We love this place. The Etoufee is BOMB!! Everything is flavorful!!

lsi4PJu1fzkre63gOer3kg.text: Starters we ordered the Lulu Wings with our drinks. Great choice! So delicious with their honey hot sauce. It is unusual for both my boyfriend and I to enjoy the same spice level, but these wings did it! He all but licked the plate.  I had the Georgia Peach cocktail. Very sweet but very delicious. Had two, and could not drive home. They do not skimp on the pour.  For dinner I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee with green olive coleslaw. I not a big green olive fan, but I heard it was one of their best sides. So for me to say it was good, even though I didn't finish it, is saying something. I also ordered it because the boy LOVES green olives. He devoured  what I didn't eat.  The Etouffee was my first and it was so good; spicy but I couldn't stop eating. Definitely had leftovers wit their portions.   The boy ordered the po'boy combo: Shredded pork po'boy with the duck & andouille gumbo. I had a bit of both, so delicious. He loved Remoulade. I believe it is horseradish.  I wouldn't call this place a hole in the wall, but it is not fine dinning. If you are only into that sort of putting, this place is not for you. But if you like great food and a fun atmosphere, this is a great place to try.  I did give them a 4 because it took a while for anybody to get to us to order and even though we ordered our starter and our mains separately, they came out on top of one another. It made things super crowded at our table and it meant our mains were cooling off. The wait staff did pack up my leftovers for me. So outside of those two minor blips, their staff was super attentive.

dV5KjJlkowEaVUwHSVaBxQ.text: Having just been to New Orleans a few months ago, I think I'm kind of ruined on Cajun food anywhere else. This place is located in a strip mall, and the building left quite a bit to be desired. There was a lot of cool art on the walls inside made by local artists that was for sale at reasonable prices. If I would've had an easy way to get a painting home, I would have bought one!   The food was just ok. I had the crawfish etoufee which had a decent spice level to it, but it was extremely thick and had a weird texture to it that I had trouble getting past. One of the people with me ordered shrimp etoufee and it was extremely soupy and has barely any shrimp. It was a pale yellow color and looked like chicken noodle soup, which was odd compared to what I've experienced in the past. Since the rue base is usually the same for these two items, it was strange to see the color and consistency so drastically different. My friend commented that the shrimp etoufee was not very spicy after he tried my dish. Also, I will note that I was supposed to get a side dish with my entree, but it never arrived. The entree portion was huge, so I didn't miss it. However, it would have been nice since it was on the menu and I ordered it.  Overall, this isn't a bad stop and I have no idea what other Cajun places exist in this area so it's an ok option if it's your chance for some Cajun food. It definitely doesn't live up to actual New Orleans food, though, but I'm not sure if anything could!

BjuROeZ1KiEReyv6UHoohg.text: The food tastes very good! This was our first time ever eating Cajun food and it did not disappoint. The waiter was very good and took his time explaining the different dishes. The Cajun combo is the way to go, it included a little bit of everything, gumbo, jambalaya, and my favorite: etoufee. Most dishes were available with either seafood or chicken and andouille sausage. We were there on a Saturday late afternoon and there was a gentleman playing live music, he was awesome and it added to the great atmosphere of the restaurant. We will be back for sure!

dNc2BiRxFySCBjlJtSnA-w.text: We have been going here for years, even when it's changed locations. Consistently great food, service and an amazing blues guitarist plays some nights!

C0hpcCZxXp6oVc_lK9hITw.text: I don't know why it took me so long to come here. They have been here for decades. My experience was really awesome. The food was delicious.  There was this older gentleman on the stage singing great tunes. Nice touch. It was my first time here and the server caught on to that and told me she would bring me samples of (3things) which i thought was awesome. From that i was able to decide what to order. I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. This is BY FAR, THE BEST CATFISH

pLaguLVQLqEe2YWqMc9otA.text: Pretty good place. Service was awesome and food was very good. Friendly staff and plenty to choose from on the menu.

KnTXac1QCb4yYTXaovq-SA.text: This is the best Cajun Food in Arizona.  While I would agree with other reviewers that the whole menu is top notch, I will add that the Crawfish Etouffee is shockingly authentic.  Even in New Orleans you will be hard pressed to find better Etouffee and Baby Kay's would impress any Yat.  I will be interested to see what the new location looks like when all the work is complete, but even the current setup still has a real New Orleans vibe.  Recommendation: Visit at happy hour.  I have eaten at Baby Kay's for years and always eat off the dinner or po'boy menu, but happy hour is quite good.  The wings/etoufee/gumbo/sliders are perfect to go with your drinks and the portions are quite generous.  This is a great way to get a taste of NOLA.

tT3LGfSVNWWL6G0IS5CY6g.text: Their catfish dinner with crawfish sauce is bomb! But we always come in large parties and that is always a problem for them to handle with the food and bills when we need them split.

GFhLaJpy6SWNpc7hc386FA.text: As Cajun Food goes there is none better in the Valley. The food is great traditional New Orleans flavors. Now saying that if you eat at the tourist traps on bourbon street and like their food you will be blown away with Baby Kays.  Get the Cajun Combo and you wont be disappointed a healthy sample of Gumbo, Etouffee, and Jambalaya. The Rene wings are great if you are looking for something different as wings go. The Smothered Pork Chops are amazing and BBQ Shrimp are great. Lots to choose from and the only Cajun Restaurant in Phoenix that serves real Cajun Food.  Will always be my Go To Cajun place

9zCkG-3l3xgfhM4oIqO0rw.text: Loved the atmosphere, full bar and food was delicious. I had the 1/2 Catfish po boy and cup of shrimp etouffee - AMAZING! My husband had the Chicken Gumbo and he loved it. We also started out with the Boudin Balls for our appetizer. They were so spicy but so good! We couldn't stop ourselves from eating them(came with 3 balls). We loved the musician that was playing the flute, violin and guitar the whole time we were there. Overall, we will be bringing friends and family here in the future! Love it!

gPAzBXveOfOb539F4GOtRg.text: The food was great. I had shrimp PO-boy. My hubby had the red beans and rice. There was an old man singing that was annoying. Who Dat!  Go Saints.

gsS51OWH_uApX7APYlzqJA.text: New (second or temporary location) for this Cajun restaurant. Came to Mesa to try it out, we ordered the catfish dinner with crawfish sauce and a half poboy & cup of seafood gumbo. (All seafood due to Ash Wednesday, wish I made it here last night )  The crawfish etouffee atop the catfish was amazing, perfect texture and flavor, I then took a bite, crispy and spicy on the outside, moist and delicious on the inside.  I don't think i have had better (except blackened, blackened is better heh) .  The gumbo was great as well, the right amount of spice, i was so missing the andouille sausage, but lent.

1xXSoJQ2S4qyAOnT9Fr-kQ.text: I wasn't a fan of southern food my husband always was, but now I absolutely love it! This place is worth the drive from all over Arizona we drive from Goodyear to Mesa. Fried Catfish and fries is so delicious! Husband loves the Combination plate of gumbo, etouffee and jambalaya. If your in town and want a memorable experience you have to come here worth every penny. Wish they had more locations throughout the valley maybe one day.

7sAWe9oXIaw8PC3WdtJYfQ.text: Great food, great bar, great server Kori. Keep it up Baby Kay's. The gumbo is delicious, the red beans and rice rock, the wings are to die for, and the fried chicken is second to none! Do yourself a favor and go get ya some!

aEqDunnhhp8Znx6LBAU13A.text: The major problem with this restaurant, and I've been there twice, is that the service is slow and poor, and that really puts me off.  A few nights ago I ate there with two other people and the restaurant was only about half full.  We were all very hungry, so I asked if we could have our garlic bread straight away.  Of course, says the waitress.  15 minutes later - no bread.  I asked again and it finally came out.  How hard can it be to toast bread and smear it with garlic butter????  Poor performance, especially since it was not busy.  The drinks were equally slow to come out.  I don't understand what is so complicated about pulling a draft beer!!!  The food is generally pretty good, especially the crawfish sauce you can get with your catfish - really great.  The jambalaya leaves a bit to be desired, however.  Too dry and starchy.  The red beans are good, though, as is the catfish, albeit a bit heavy on the batter.  Oh, I grew up in Cajun country, so I know how it should be prepared.

k0QF1PYD7YhkwWROI7zikA.text: I haven't been exposed to too much Cajun dining but I was thoroughly impressed with my meal. I had the gumbo and the jambalaya, both chicken and sausage, and both tasted great. I like my food spicy and rarely do I have a meal I don't think about adding hot sauce and this was one, and not because of the heat but because of the flavor and heat!

Cu5sNq7UZaDs8-W9DavVIw.text: Amazing food. Cool atmosphere. Great service. I'm really glad it was recommended to us. My new favorite in the neighborhood.

A6DLYjNTMMTWRWEK29pt6A.text: I had seen this place for a while I stopped in it's a small personal place good is very good the service was amazing I would recommend to anyone Ricky was my server she was great. Good portions if you leave hungry it's your fault give it a try

Ait3Fisqmr9nyktd7aI9YQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! My husbands family is from Louisiana, so when his uncle told me about this place I jumped at the chance to go. The wait time for a table wasn't bad at all for a Friday night. The food was amazing! We ordered the combo appetizer  but the waiter forgot to put it in. We reminded him and he put it in for us and we got it free. That was fine with us. My sister doesn't like seafood so she had the chicken Alfredo and she said it was very tasty.

yK-M8mjZ9JKvlxx1-IDqHQ.text: We just happened upon Baby Kay's just days after it opened.  We have been there many times since then and it just keeps getting better and better.  The ambience is awesome and the older gentleman that provides the live music is delightful.  You can not find a better place to eat with a warm, friendly atmosphere and to top it off - Baby Kay's has the best catfish in AZ!.

8GAcN8oI9kfNQQqyBEl81g.text: I started out with their LuLu Wings (Amazing) Then went for the Cajun Combo and that was the perfect trio for Cajun food.

EcWnsdo3mEMCPZjOv5hNVw.text: Just ok, nothing to brag about.. A little pricy for what you get.. Salads are a rip-off if you ask me. Seems a little on the generic, canned, frozen side of things.. Not too bad, but not to good either, there are better places to spend my money..

b5RrLe-BdC5E-j9RulZW5A.text: I started with hush puppies ($2.00 1/2 basket) and came with a creamy horseradish sauce and a smoky and slightly sweet BBQ dipping sauce. Both were tasty. SHlHJGqQomKsXKBQ6WFvaA.text: Who would have thought you could get food cajun food in AZ. It's here. REAL horseradish :)

0kyHzOe_ubBoN7pRi2QOog.text: First time and we weren't disappointed, We started with crab cake and shrimp remoulade appetizer. Then for the main course, we had a seafood combo of fried items and the catfish dinner with the crawfish sauce & green olive coleslaw. All items were excellent. Service was very good, attentive and very friendly. The draft beer selection could use improvement and we were told that adding serveral items was already a work in progress. We would recommend this offering to anybody who likes authentic food "big easy" style.

ZtK_9qCFy55sbkOm1neGDw.text: I love this place. I live in San Diego and the first thing I do when I get off the plane in Phoenix is go here. They have the best catfish po boys I've ever had.

7YIceZvc6xuhwoZrhiCh7g.text: The bf and I came here for lunch. I had the cajun combo (gumbo, jambalaya, etouffee) and he had the appetizer sampler platter (shrimps and crab cakes). Forgot to take pics but we loved the food! The dining is casual with awesome blues music playing over the speakers. Our waitress Ricky was great and friendly and always made sure we had our teas refilled. Lastly we had the bread pudding which was amazing! We will definitely be back!

YmxyGEQc_Hi9s3FmsXSMfA.text: After reading all of the great reviews, I was disappointed with the quality of food. Authenticity, flavor and freshness was very poor.

OkdtPBNcaMIUC52MGtQ-Tw.text: The atmosphere was the best. Good vibes and the man playing is just wonderful. My honest opinion is this definitely isn't REAL CAJUN GUMBO....more like chicken soup...it didn't even have ANY spicy ness in it. Maybe it's the are & there aren't many real authentic Cajun or bbq spots around.

nWpeaWYvbR8d6HKJoziMZQ.text: Excellent Food and Service  Stop by Fri April 12  4-8 and enjoy sidewalk business event. Service and live blues music is awesome!!!

nkhTCjNNlhZEMZRjzUGSrA.text: I've heard about how good the food was at Baby Kay's for years. Today I finally got a chance to pop in and order a bunch of food for my family and I for dinner. The point was to try as many things on the menu as possible! We tried fried catfish, chicken & sausage gumbo, shrimp etouffee, red beans & rice, dirty rice, crawfish, honey BBQ wings and fettuccini Alfredo. Val took my order and helped me make the choices. She was very professional (and patient - because I asked a LOT of questions!)  I also asked about the possibility of frying a turkey for Christmas because they fry a bunch of turkeys for Thanksgiving every year and they're supposed to be REALLY good! Martin came and helped when I was asking about the turkey and he was very helpful as well.  You have some great employees and great food Baby Kay's! Looking forward to coming back and hearing the live music.

OKswYILjj5aWQ6AqlwnciQ.text: Rib sticking red beans and rice, cold beers and a live blues guitar player. What more could you ask for. I had eaten at the Phoenix location years ago and have been a fan of the Mesa location since it opened. Don't let the outside fool you, once you walk through the door, the interior decor, smell of the foods, and sounds of the blues playing take you to another world. I have never gotten the chance to go to Louisiana so I cannot speak for authenticity of the food but it's good. From the red beans and rice to the mango habanero salad dressing, it's good.   The Louisiana beers and bar drinks don't disappoint, and pair well with the food.   The parking can sometimes be an issue, but most of the time, you can get in when you need to.

Ko1lYCfbR2qH1J4HcqluGg.text: Went here for a week-day lunch with co-workers and was beyond impressed. Sometimes spicy food is just spice and no flavor. Not here. It was just the right amount of kick with a whole lot of flavor. Loved it an will def. come back.

B11A2d9CWSnBxAzTSB0jGw.text: Absolutely amazing! I almost licked the plate clean (ok I did). Best restaurant I've been to in Phoenix. Awesome establishment, great service and Food...OMG. A must try!!!!

TzOpquQKDEMQvSZS_dWjvA.text: My family of four come here regularly.  Although a few dishes are not exactly as my experience in New Orleans, Baby Kay's is by far one of the best Cajun restaurants in Phoenix area. Try a Cajun mule to start your meal and tip the musician on your way out. It is a good place to be.

RUOQCscd497tWWtlGnXl_g.text: So so so yummy!! The catfish was by far my favorite thing on the menu. Very fresh and flavorful. Very nice portions, highly recommend

7BU7GXheOvuEhSZIKbBJYQ.text: Amazing atmosphere and delicious food!!  Lulu wings, hush puppies, and crawfish etouffee were al amazing!

tazEeOMJ7uGnjBdF7mGcuw.text: This place is awesome!! The Lulu's wings are perfectly crispy with a really unique flavor! I highly recommend them! My husband got a combination plate and loved the etouffee. We will definitely be back and try more menu items.

InF3repSn8o1GxKVln4_oQ.text: I love gumbo and this place makes pretty good gumbo.  I love the blues guitarist.  A good vibe.  I have been a couple of times.  I was not a fan of the jambalaya.  The catfish looked great but I did not get to sample it.  This is a reasonably priced restaurant.

me9DBGfFBf_vy4HJvcLhPQ.text: This is my second visit and the food was delicious and I love the live music!! The waitresses could have been a little more attentive and not look so disheveled but the food was great and we had an amazing time!!

ztuaMaicXeGS4abrsO24RQ.text: great service and atmosphere! My husband ate the crawfish etouffee, expensive, but he said it was well worth it, the best he's ever had. I had the sampler, it was great, perfect amount of spice!

-F0-22cOHSDq1X_3jDOPCw.text: The beast authentic Cajun food and vibe around. Had the Crawfish Etoufee, nice size bowl, plenty of meat. Ball of white rice in the middle to mix in. Definitely had some heat, but not overpowering.  Others had the seafood gumbo, great flavor and again some heat but delicious. Also shrimp and oyster poboy. Nice light crunch on the breading of the seafood. Remoulade had a ton of horseradish. Careful! Fun experience, live Cajun tunes, gives it that fun atmosphere.

gJUjQh-vo2q3p8CINtS2wA.text: Made from scratch.  Awesome service. The best chicken wings I've ever had. Their Cajun food is unmatched! Amazing everything!

9Bzsig0-93yOJzVOD3eoDg.text: Knowing that authentic, high quality Cajun food is not that easy to find around Phoenix, I was excited to try Baby Kay's as soon as I found out about it.  I was very impressed with Baby Kay's and will be adding it to my regular rotation of restaurants.   To begin, the food is exceptional.  The fried catfish is flaky and falls apart very easily, as all good catfish should.  If I had one complaint, it would be that there was a little too much salt in the batter, but it did not severely hamper my enjoyment of the meal.  The serving size is very large and would be enough for 2 dinners.  The entrees also come with either a side salad, potato salad, or coleslaw.  I chose the potato salad, which was very good, but I did not eat much of it because I was focused on the catfish.  It is well worth paying the extra $3.00 for the crawfish sauce.    The pricing is very fair for the portion size and quality of the food.  I ordered the fried catfish dinner with crawfish sauce, which was about $20.  However, this was one of the most expensive items on the menu.  Many of the options are around $10.00 to $15.00.  All the serving sizes were very large, as well, and the food was well worth the price.    The ambiance and atmosphere of Baby Kay's is one of the main reasons that I will continue to come back.  There is an elderly man who plays live guitar during dinner and it is quite enjoyable.  He plays with a backing track and the music is just at the right volume where you can have a good dinner conversation and still enjoy the music.  I may even end up eating here again by myself at some point because the music is so enjoyable that I could focus on it for a whole dinner.  The restaurant also has a sort-of "hidden" vibe to it, which I thought was cool.  The windows are blacked out and you cannot see in from the outside.  When I first got there I thought they were closed.  Once I opened the door and saw that every table was full and the guitarist was playing I was a little bit surprised.  It was almost like a scene out of a movie.    The service was great, as well.  Our drinks were always refilled before we even noticed that we needed them.  In addition, they bring an extra vase with about another one and a half glasses of the drink, so refills are never a problem.  The food came quickly and, despite it being crowded, we were given a lot of attention.  Overall, there is no reason that I can think of to not come back to Baby Kay's.  I look forward to many more trips here and trying more of the menu, including some of the specials that were written on the wall.

Once we put our order in of the Fried Shrimp with Dirty Rice & The Seafood Gumbo, it was given to us in maybe 5-10 mins. There was hardly any wait! The food & service was amazing!!! They have a gentleman who was playing blues music live which made for a Great atmosphere!  We will definitely be back!! This is a restaurant YOU HAVE TO VISIT!!!

-XpNF7EEGsXr_KGG9qv1vw.text: We loved this place! We assumed it was going to be busy on a Saturday evening so we called in a reservation. However, although they had a steady business, it was not crowded at all...which is a darn shame!    I ordered the cajun combination which has gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. It was amazing!!! Fresh, tasty, with just the right amount of cajun kick.  Our server was great (thank you Leslie) and service was very fast!   There was a gentleman in the corner playing blues guitar which added to the relaxed atmosphere. We have nothing bad to say about Baby Kay's. We recommend it to everyone and we will be back!

yeDWuBgq9TnDOUVuw_5ExA.text: I've been a huge fan of Baby Kay's for years, I use to frequent them when they were by the Biltmore. Still good cajun food, the whole Bayou atmosphere.  I think it's a bit pricey, thats the only thing that keeps me from coming here more often.  Over all the years the food is still great!!!

RVjJ522_wjnKdoLBWnp7kA.text: While Baby Kays's seems like a misplacement in the valley, the food takes me back to my favorite New Orleans memories.  The plates are large and so are the flavors but you will not walk out disappointed. I loved the confluence of local Mexican art in creole culture and I have yet to buy some art to put on my walls at home.  Overall a solid 5. I would definitely go back in the future.

e2xVvjFdWTxgpN8I1XMhwA.text: This restaurant does a good job of representing Cajun food from Louisiana.    The portions were bigger than we had seen in the various photos on Yelp.   There were seven of us and we had a variety of dishes.   With the most noteworthy one being the chicken and Andouille sausage.   Three of us had a cup of this gumbo and it was delicious.  The crawfish etouffee was delicious and plentiful.   In fact, it was so filling that I didn't have enough room to finish the seafood gumbo.   The garlic bread is a nice addition to the meal and toned down some of the spiciness.    All of us agreed that the food was unique and good and that we would all return for another experience to sample to more of the menu items.

ZH28DBK69GfVFk2Aar9oJw.text: I was really excited to try this place we went and picked up an order to go we live about 20 minutes from the restaurant and when we got home to sit down and eat our food we'd found a hair in it.  we called the place and told them about the situation and they were willing to give us a free pasta but After experiencing that it was just not worth going back.  the customer service was great I'm pretty sure they don't put hair in everybody's food, stuff happens but the proper precautions should be taken to prevent that.

h-jOg3wgTaDjhDga2sjGOg.text: At first the service was slow they were slammed... I can understand- However once we ordered they were on point. We got the sea food sampler with fried oysters! BOMB! vLwKmIFOIQkmn1JslOyaaQ.text: This place is so good that I ate here for the first time recently and came back a 2nd time 4 days later.  When you come get the LuLu Wings for an appetizer.  They are breaded, fried and drenched in a honey Tabasco type sauce that is literally finger licking good.  I'll order garlic bread just to mop up the leftover sauce with.  The first time we came here was on a Saturday night and I ordered their daily special which was the Smothered Pork Chop dinner.  It comes with a side of warm bourbon fruit cocktail and my 2 sides I chose was the dirty rice and the potato salad.  I swear the pick chop was a double cut thick chop smothered in a brown gravy.  The pork was so tender you did not need a knife to cut it.  The dirty rice had a nice kick to it and the potato salad was a nice compliment to the meal.  4 days later we came back for Happy Hour.  I had the wings again and had a shrimp n oyster poboy with house made potato chips.  A very meaty sandwich and the chips were tasty.  I can't wait to try their jambalaya next.

5p9GBy8VWbvzBaslnlHgGg.text: Can't say enough good things about this place!!! How have we not visited before?? Sweet tea, duck & andouille gumbo, lulus wings, catfish basket and shrimp fettuccine were all exceptional and delicious! Service was perfect. This is now our go to spot for date night. Love everything about it. Thank you!!!!!!

XEemjmkz5sstMHvL3GbcBA.text: My friend and I came here for a birthday dinner. The food and service were both excellent. The food is not cooked super spicy hot but there is a choice of pepper sauces available. Dessert portions were very generous!

LVeF6mZona0aLNyJxFKJYw.text: Baby Kay's was an experience as much as a wonderful meal. There was live music playing (blues), their decor makes you feel like you're in New Orleans, and there was incredible service. Our waitress was very attentive, kind, and helpful. It was nice because all of the waiting staff helped each other out, so drinks weren't empty for long, and we got our plates bussed as soon as we were done. The food was absolutely delicious: I got the Cajun Combo, but the stand-out there was the Crawfish Etouffe. It had a nice little kick to it. Paired with a New Orleans beer and the complimentary garlic bread, this meal was the epitome of satisfying. Highly recommend this place--I will certainly return soon.

ZZ2i1Qac02b0T21YryydHw.text: "Baby, how it eat?" GOOD. DELICIOUS. I'm Nola blood and it is very hard to find a meal that taste like a New Orleans native cooked it! Eating anywhere is Arizona, or anywhere outside of New Orleans for that matter, I don't expect much. I usually expect for something to be called one thing but be another (like in flagstaff I got a "crab cake poboy" but it came on a brioche bun! What the heck!!). Here at Baby Kay's, I got crawfish etouffee and a shrimp poboy. Baby, it taste just like home! I was in shock and wished I didn't order half orders. Best creole food in AZ hands down.  two thumbs up from me!!

Dvjnon0gZMCzUQSHxaSnAg.text: Omg, I am in Cajun heaven. So how did I end up her...well, I've passed by this place several time. It used to be called Cajun Kitchen. One day I stopped in after I was craving some good Cajun food and the place was shut down. Well my craving came back and noticed this Cajun place was back in the same spot but under a different name. Shout out to Kate M.!! I read her review and I was salivating of all the nice things she had to say about this place and the photos she posted so I had to give it a try.   When we first walked in I noticed the music they were placing and it definitely gave it a Louisiana feel. The place isn't very big but comfortably spaced so you don't feel like you will smack the person behind you if you turn around too quick. We were immediately greeted by hostess who seated us in a nice location so that we could get a good view of the rest of the place since this was my first time here. We ordered cup of chicken gumbo as I was so eager to satisfy my Cajun craving.  Didn't take too long and the food came with a side of their succulent garlic bread. Gumbo was super good and I wish I would have ordered the bowl but I didn't want to get too full because there were so many other things I wanted to try. I ended up ordering the shrimp etouffee which was good but it had an overwhelming amount of onions. I can definitely say I will be back to try other things on the menu but gumbo is a must.   Great fast service and great place for Cajun food.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Shrimp etouffee
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Chicken gumbo with a hurricane in the background.

cnWfMLcUWaSOcU4Z_bch3g.text: This place was sooooo delicious! I had the shrimp etoufee and catfish platter. My mom had a cup of gumbo and the catfish platter. I'm definitely going back here

PrWGUQkopLgANqjP0LzROw.text: The ambiance was nice with live music. The decorations were reminisince of a party city Mardi Gras but some of it works. Didn't order any drinks, but the bar had a nice atmosphere.  Tonight we ordered the Cajun combination and the Cornish game hen. We got the duck and saugage gumbo which was too salty and had a definite kick. The jambalaya was different without the tomato base, but the chicken and sausage added great flavor to the rice. The crawfish etoufee was on point! There was plenty of crawfish and the flavor was remincince of a clam chowder. The Cornish game hen was fried nicely with crispy skin, but overly salty at some points if you got too much skin.

X4SrbBv9KSMwwNw_sAs0Cg.text: I love hush puppies and this place has the best hush puppies I've had in a long time! I also had a delicious spinach salad with chicken.   The staff is nice and the theme is rad. it could make for a super romantic date night, and definitely my new fave night time spot but the lights were on so bright when we went in for dinner.   The windows are shaded really dark to keep out the Arizona sun's heat which is great, but misleading. We walked in expecting it to be dim mood lighting and jazz music but instead it was really bright and open. Not very private and romantic, which was what i was hoping it would be. Really took from the ambience. Im hoping they set up some mood lighting to go with the jazz theme. :) and maybe a couple booths.   But that's just how I'd like it, maybe they're going for a dif mood. :)  Either way, get those delicious hush puppies!!

nq5RloSf21oXF5vhr1DC6A.text: On a date here Saturday night.  We ate the crawfish etouffee and shrimp basket while listening to live jazz music.  The crawfish was definitely frozen.  It did not take fresh at all.  Compared to the crawfish etouffee I normally get in South Houston close to Galveston Bay, this would be barely edible.  However I understand we are in Valley so it is what it is.  The shrimp basket was good and the homemade chips were great.  I'd give that 4-stars.  Service was good here.  Drinks were horribly made.  I returned the hurricane and painkiller.  I felt bad after returning the first 2 drinks and kept the third (renee margarita), even though it was just as bad as the first drink.  Don't try drinks here.  If I rated this restaurant to Houston's top crawfish places, it would rate a 1-star.  If rated to New Orleans best places, it would rate a zero.  Update: I don't like wasting food as I ate a couple bites Saturday night so I brought it home. Upon heating it on the stove for lunch at noon the next day, I felt bad for the rest of the day after eating it.  Won't be coming back.  Maybe some things should be thrown away.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. crawfish etouffee

YWGq55sEYV5ubWC9OxdNHQ.text: I love the LuLu wings and the live music! I went on a Saturday and had a blast. The decor is nice and the art in the wall is up for sale. With that being said, I was disappointed in the red beans and rice or chicken and sausage gumbo. I go to New Orleans all the time and I love red beans and rice and gumbo! So I was excited to try this place here in Arizona. My only complaint with this restaurant is that the food wasn't seasoned well and I had to add a lot of salt, and the rice was hard. Not crunchy hard, but I like my rice soft. It reminded me of the 5 minute boil-in-a-bag rice. My dad has the seafood basket and he said it was delicious and their horseradish sauce was spicy and delicious. The staff was nice and attentive. And they have a chalk board with daily specials for both lunch and dinner. If I go back, it would be for the Lulu wings and live music.

IuRzsWnn7gBHTCMIEw2wMw.text: A taste of New Orleans in Mesa, Arizona! Baby Kay's has an amazing selection of truly Cajun cooking. This charmer has a following of regulars and I am sure once you dine here you will be as well.

I had shrimp etouffee and jumbalaya in a combo, with potato salad. All were excellent! I will definitely be back, and next time, I'll bring friends.

YK0tgg4vQC_SUjRCO2Ishg.text: A great place for good Cajun type seafood!! Portions are huge! Try the catfish with the crawfish sauce on it. You will not be disappointed!! We are definitely coming back to this place! Also the jazz music was good too!'

9owqNJiZAw34Lqh_T8ToUQ.text: We brought a party of 8 in for my dad's birthday, we are in Phoenix for summer vacation. We did not make any reservations just popped in. My dad LOVES cajun food, and man were we blown away! We both got the cajun combination featuring gumbo (we upgraded to the seafood gumbo), Jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee! You also get a side and garlic bread. All three dishes were delicious, I chose a side of green olive slaw. Which was mouthwatering, and my dad got a salad. My mom got dirty rice, and I tried a bite of that as well!! It was so yummy! My husband got the creole burger he said is was good! The flavor was great. Kids got random dishes but I do have to say that was some of the best cajun food I have ever had! The bread pudding was pretty good too. The server was awesome, she was knowledgeable and so sweet. My mom has a seafood allergy and the wait staff was sure to be careful!

CW26fwZuN_hHaklSDa5fGA.text: I can say with 100% certainty that this place has my favorite Cajun food. It was packed when my friends and I went on a Friday night and suffice it to say it was worth the wait. My friends had ordered a sampler appetizer that came with battered shrimp, hush puppies, and fried oysters - it was awesome. I ordered the delicious seafood gumbo cup, the other option was a bowl but I knew I wouldn't finish it. I tried the fettuccine alfredo one of my buds ordered and it was probably the best pasta I've had in a long time. My other friends had ordered combination plates so I tried the seafood etoufee that had huge pieces of crab and shimp in it, I should've ordered my own! I'm not sure how many nights a week they have it but there was a live jazz musician playing near the front entrance and it transformed the atmosphere into how I imagine most places in New Orleans really are. 11/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Half a catfish po boy and seafood gumbo

diZwnQeoZz-Y8fBAeh80Nw.text: Amazing hidden gem. The hush puppies were amazing, and the shrimp and clam basket was great and the sweet potato fries were on point. Go try it!

9b7JL04JFwTSo1WXtzbkVg.text: Oh Baby Kay how I love your food. All these folks complaining about not getting a decent creole inspired meal haven't been here. If you're looking for a deep and layed meal, go see Baby Kay. Happy hour is ridiculously well priced for the giant portion sizes and you will never leave hungry regardless of the time frame you go in. Support Baby Kay and not some imitation chain serving frozen food... do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States

Z0z2aEvGPyONfCAItowULw.text: I used to love going to Baby Kay until I got served with a cold dish of Crawfish Etouffe on two different occasion which is why my rating is only a 3 star. When you first open the door to the restaurant you will be greeted with loud live music. I think the best course of action is to lower the volume because often time you cannot hear the person next to you talk. The staffs are very friendly and helpful with menu questions. Unfortunately, after being served food cold twice leads me to believe the resturant just microwave my order up leaving a bad taste in my mouth.   Jambalaya: Did not like it as much as the gumbo. Crawfish Etouffee: My favorite dish from their menu. Chicken and Sausage Gumbo: The gumbo was very tasty and I enjoyed it a lot. Oyster Basket: Tasted very fresh and extremely delicious would order again

pT_S6tRYWMacd_rlox5_iw.text: I just have to give Baby Kay's more words.  This food is just awesome.  The Etouffee is to die for, you'll be hard pressed to find its equal in New Orleans, and I've tried!  They deliver consistant high quality food, I'm always super impressed with their Lulu wings.  They're breaded, fried and tossed in a fantastic sweet spicy sauce.  The wings themselves are also of high quality, I've never found any place in the valley that serves wings with so much meat on them, they aren't sacrificing quality to provide a reasonable price happy hour here.  I also recommend happy hour for the sampling of so many good things, split a cup of chicken gumbo or a cup of Etouffee and some of the sliders.  Everything is palate pleasing.  Don't forget dessert, get the chocolate bourbon sunday.  And make sure you're splitting it at least 4 ways, its massive and super sweet!  We are also ice tea people, some places get it right and some don't, its the good stuff here.  Doesn't have to be flashy to compliment a good meal!  The staff is also great, they really seem to care and somehow even import a little of that New Orleans charm (if ya know what I mean).

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. You can&#39;t buy happiness, but you CAN buy gumbo.
Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Lulu Wings.  Just do it...they are awesome.  Spicy and sweet, somehow the wings are still crispy too.

YC1avbA0t8oVW4KP6KxLOw.text: This place is killer! The staff is awesome! The menu unreal! Bar is well stocked, and the waits are reasonable. Live music takes you straight back to New Orleans. The smothered pork chop special is something I recommend every time we take friends and when they order something else they always steal mine. It's a special Friday and Saturday I believe.

hUdfPEiZxRDi3NA3enkpdg.text: Unreal Cajun food. Best in town so far, by far.  Service was kinda shitty. Especially considering we went at 2pm and there were like 6 people working.  The food however is off the chains.

Z6WG0a430UeAonZVzcMpoQ.text: Went here after a long hot day of logistical business. We had the chicken and sausage gumbo and their cajun burger. Both were very good. Spicy! I liked it but my nose ran a lot. It has a habit of doing that.... the carmelized onions and bleu cheese with the sausage in the beef patty all rolled up into one nice bite. The drinks were great, too! The gumbo seemed pretty authentic and was very tasty. I would recommend this place.

TMVLoQoFUvIkCBsZUrfapQ.text: This is the best Cajun restaurant  I. Phoenix  proper. We had the lulu wings which has a nice tangy sauce . Chicken was cooked to perfection nice and crunch and moist in the middle . I just live their gumbo.  Lots of meat and lots of spices and heat. The crawfish ettouffe is also a signature  dish. Lots of meat and lots of flavors.  Service is always attentive  and the jazz music is great background

KcdJPcEPFkYHAxDmLEhPCA.text: Having recently relocated from the North Valley to Fountain Hills, we had to find some new places to eat! We were introduced to Baby Kay's by good friends a few months ago and we just can't get enough!!  Our journey began with the Boudin Balls - amazing sausage croquette style appetizers with HEATED apricot jam. WOW! The jam itself is something I had to get the recipe for! The cup of Seafood Gumbo was large enough for me to split with my hubby - and the flavors were amazing! Crawfish Etouffee was a great base for the fried shrimp dinner!  Hubby ordered the Fried Chicken (Special on Thursdays) and the seasoning was hot and flavorful - crispy as always! I tried a friend's catfish & was pleasantly surprised - since I'm not a fish eater - it was pretty good!  Dessert - well that HUGE Chocolate Bourbon Sundae was shared by all 4 of us!  Before I finish I MUST mention the drinks! Try one of the house specials - they hit a home run with them every time! Bring s designated driver - because they pack a PUNCH!  A special p.s. to our waiter most nights - Martine' (pronounced Marteeen) BEST SERVICE EVER!! Consistent quality, service and so far not one bad experience. Need I say the place is spotless, funky, jazzy in a New Orleans way - OK I just did! BonAppetite!! Our FAVORITE PLACE ! Worth the drive!

p_DB1KQTerH6jNu5e-ciIQ.text: Not too many places I can get food that taste like home. This place measures up big time.  !!!!

4JPD3XEQVso_SDfryPt8IQ.text: Great service. Forgot the name of the guy that served us. Food was exceptionally good. Never had tried gumbo but had it this Saturday 3/11 for the first time and it was delicious. Great vibe with a great performer. Felt like I was in The south. I would definitely be back on my next trip to AZ.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. The best shrimp I&#39;ve tried. Tangy and spicy in taste.

brI2CebmZfFsfWp_U_H3og.text: This was my first time trying Cajun cuisine and I'll say that the crawfish etouffee and the Lulu wings were to die for! Our waitress was very friendly also!

jORQvSfieEhOOBmlUcXf-A.text: Etoufee is to die for!   I've only ordered takeout. So I can't speak on the dine in experience. Everyone I've picked up food from was very friendly.

EfsOrIJRCSGl6wb9UYyuZw.text: We looked for Gumbo and found this place. Gumbo is awesome! I went there twice in two weeks!! I had Chicken Gumbo (light taste), Sliders and Jambalaya. a9bsocElRMf6uNNe-e8jog.text: If only this place wasn't so far! Have came here about 5 or 6 times and have not been disappointed. From the crawfish etoufee to just fried catfish. It's all amazing and I don't know a better restaurant. Good live music as well as great drinks.

s4cd0E4CurdU4Xf8KNwV5w.text: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!! My wife and I live in the neighborhood and have been driving right past this place for years and never stopped, but... a friend of ours went on and on about how good it was so we checked it out. aKr2uEy5ErVZFbydqldLmg.text: I was excited to find this place here in Arizona. It's a small comfortable family restaurant in Mesa and embodies the soulful, cultural, and harmonious seasons of Louisiana. The food was good and I can't wait to try other options the restaurant offers. I ordered the Craw Fish Etouffe w/white rice, fried catfish and green olive Cole slaw. I wasn't fond of the Cole slaw definitely not within my taste buds but everything else was delicious. We also had hush puppies!! Loved them.   My friend ordered the jambalaya and seafood gumbo which I was told was great but gumbo was VERY spicy.   I ordered take out so I didn't experience any memorable customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Craw Fish Etouffe: It was really good. Seasoned well, little spicy but not too spicy. Delicious!

GZDFKJa8fRb_OlpDMmf-sQ.text: Nice Cajun food. We started with the combo appetizer that would possibly be enough for two normal eaters. I had the crawfish etoufee and my wife had the seafood gumbo. Both were fantastic. The wine list was short, but the cab was good. We are planning to come back with our daughter. Try it if you like Cajun.

uB08uMhJqNIiAP__TJAUIQ.text: Delicious! The last time we were here, I got the Poboy Sandwich and didn't like it, but this time, I got Fettucine with Vegetables, and I ate every bit of it! 0yafZxofgNXnDKCb2OxPIg.text: Y'all are out of this world with your food! Service was on point and very consistent! The food came out fast, hot, and delicious!! I can't wait to come back, we were there on a Friday and the live music amazing! Thanks, Love Sam

Rg_FlVwKSP1kwo_F7TwHAw.text: Writing this review while crying because I just found out they are closed on Sunday's?!  Okay - this is one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. It is amazing every time I go - I love the Cajun fettuccine it is AMAZING and a must try. The fried catfish is life changing, the shrimp etoufee is some of the best I ever had! Highly recommend  Let me wipe my tears now

Lzd2g8Dih4C09_U1mopZwA.text: Laissez les bon temp rouler! It means, "let the good times roll."  Came in for Happy Hour and shared a cup of Duck & Andouille Gumbo, a cup of Crawfish Etouffee, and some Lulu wings. I also got a Cajun Bloody Mary (although I ordered a Cajun Mule but I didn't want to bother the waitress to correct this).   The food was amazingly tasty! I was especially enamored by the etouffee. "Etouffee" means, "smothered," and yo, you can etouffee me with their crawfish etouffee all day! Yum! The gumbo was pretty good. It was rich, had good flavor, and the duck was so tender. That Cajun Mary wasn't my cup of tea though. Too smoky, too acidic, and way too much pepper. I really wish the waitress got me the Cajun Mule I had ordered as I left my Cajun Mary mainly untouched at the table.  This place could be a fais-do-do with its live music. It's a dark and kinda dingy hole-in-the-wall but they have crispy flavorful chicken and an etouffee that'll make yo mama an' them happy and full. Get your Cajun eats here!  Happy Hour is Mon-Fri 2-6PM, Sat 2-5PM.

hclUxY-w35z7EsSyVG6wTg.text: If you like spice, smooth music, and a laid-back atmosphere with great food, this is your place. I've been wanting to get Cajun food for a while now, and I am happy to report Baby Kay's helped make this experience a winner.   Now, if you're into the blues music, you'll love this restaurant right off the bat (like my husband who couldn't stop signing along). Thank goodness we had an easy-going server because we took our SWEET time deciding too. We ended up getting a variety of dishes, but the Gumbo, jambalaya, and po boys were the faves. I seriously could have licked my gumbo bowl clean, I enjoyed it that much.   I will warn that most dishes pack a punch of heat, but they do offer a few items for the more faint at heart so everyone can have a good meal. Prices are nice too, and I regret not trying the bread pudding but I hear it's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Gumbo, jambalaya, and shrimp etouffee. First two were the best.

K_cNfeYZ1e84yI7grbIVBA.text: Mardi Gras week had me hankering for Cajun/creole food and no fast food option like I had available in Indy. I gave my boyfriend a few options and he picked here. We had such a great time despite the lengthy visit!   Forewarning they do not take reservations on Mardi Gras, but if you aren't in a rush, post up at the bar, have a festive drink and enjoy the sights and smells of Baby Kay's while you wait (or on any other day with a wait). It was great to have live music and everyone be in a jovial mood on the special holiday. Hurricanes are a must when you come to Baby Kay's as well as delicious hush puppies with some of their nose-watering horseradish sauce.   While the entire menu sounded good, the only thing I was solely interested in was shrimp etoufee. And it was worth the wait. Does not look like the most appealing bowl of food, but it certainly was satisfying and satiating. There was a perfect balance of spice and heat, complemented with juicy shrimp. I only wish I could've finished the entire bowl, but it filled me up quickly. While the four of us caught our breaths, our waitress brought up dessert. And happened to pass by with a few selections. We went with bread pudding, something I wasn't much of a fan of before, but with their warm alcoholic butter sauce.... I was hooked!   You are guaranteed a good evening and a hearty meal at Baby Kay's- and I look forward to returning many times for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Shrimp etoufee

YjZ-nk_T3lDX0P-3Z3am6g.text: I haven't been here since they moved from the Biltmore area but it's just as good as it's always been. We went during happy hour a party of 3 and it was not busy at all which was great. Gumbo was full of flavor and the Crawfish Etouffee was nice and spicy. The lulu wings are always nice and crispy but I remember them to be more spicy that super sweet so that was a tttaadd off for me. Needless to say the food was excellent the vibe was comforting and the service was precise. I even got to pick out a desert for my birthday (sweet potato pie) and it was sssssooooooooooo good. Missed this place and will be back for sure

Kjb6iv8yHqWkV2qzIjS-xg.text: So I love gumbo but I've never had it authentic till now? They advertise as being authentic but since I've never had it beforehand I'm not quite sure. It definitely tastes different than what I'm used to (but spoiler alert it's delicious). The waitress is friendly and checks up on you often. Apparently her boyfriend is from New Orleans and loves the crawfish etouffee and seafood gumbo. So if he likes it, then I'm pretty sure it's authentic.  Besides authenticity, the gumbo and etouffee are delicious! They are worth every bite. Both dishes highlight its main ingredient-- they don't skimp out either! If you're wondering the difference between gumbo and etouffee, gumbo is more like a soup (a thinner consistency) and etouffee is a stew (thicker than gumbo). The duck gumbo has a bit of a kick to it whereas the crawfish etouffee is a flavor blast of crawfish.  I'd say skip out on the jambalaya. It's not what you'd expect when ordering it. It's like plainly seasoned rice with andouille sausage.  My boyfriend ordered the alligator and clam basket. I took a quick bite and it was decent.  I'm definitely coming back here again for more gumbo and etouffee (and to try their crab cakes). I came during happy hour and they have a good selection of beer. Next time I'll come when they have live music.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen - Mesa, AZ, United States. Crawfish etouffee, garlic bread, and Tabasco &amp; honey wings

dwdvar9cb8ySpf5PlbRIgA.text: Legit Cajun comfort food in a warm atmosphere. Service was friendly and the food came out quickly. Lulu wings are sweet, spicy and sticky. I can confirm they are a top 10 wing here in the valley as per AZ Central.

s9vrsLhQ-M11nt7lh65aQg.text: Talk about SOUL-food!!! You can definitely taste the love in the recipes at this mouth watering dive.   We thoroughly enjoyed the hush puppies; crawfish etoufee (sp?) and seafood gumbo. The catfish with crawfish sauce was delish, but I have to say the top three and must tries are the first three.   The jambalaya was o.k. It was still good, but drier than most and the rice was a bit over cooked. Yes, even with the sauce, I felt the rice was a bit over soggy, yet dry at the same time. See photo for what I mean!   Overall, a great experience and another food-cess!

rLdxIAq1rtVpW12hoj_6_w.text: This is my third time at this awesome place. I was so lucky to be introduced to real gem when it comes to Cajun food.   Real live jazz playing by an older gentlemen, great service and even better food.   They have amazing lunch and dinner specials, you can't go working with anything on the menu.   Things I've had that I could easily eat every day; Cajun Burger, Po Boy, Gumbo, hushpuppies and the Alfredo.   The place is in a small strip down on Dobson. Parking isn't limited, they also have a small outdoor patio to enjoy the wonderful atmosphere.   Fried chicken is also off the chain, they normally have it on weekly specials.   Don't forget to try the Key Lime Pie as well, it is scrumptious!

vjssm0p9Rh1-HA9NGP1oPA.text: Eh very bland. I ordered take out the food was kind of hot. Burger was bland, fries bland and without salt, even the ranch was flavor less. I had to spice it up and add my own flavor... should of spent my $11.94 else where. Burger was just falling apart due to the patty not being made well. I'm from the south and these aren't southern flavors. Good blue music playing. Small and packed house. Won't be back. Wouldn't be surprised if I'm sick in the morning either... stay tuned

LBKW86AJbfszJfTJLSSsNw.text: If you like Cajun spice, then you'll dig this place.  Even have nighttime live music.  I had the sampler - and it was all amazing.

8JNlWqb_QSjIQe03xmiQcg.text: This place has five star potential however service could be better. Food is really good. As a person born and raised in Louisiana, the crawfish jambalaya is bomb.com (highly recommended). The Lulu chicken is amazing. The Jambalaya is all wrong. Don't do it. It is like season rice with breakfast sausage. The waiters could offer better information when questioned about the menu and have a more attention to detail. Overall, the food is good.

8n7g2_l3hCJSqxwWk8-0Hg.text: AMERICANS! PLEASE TRY THE DUCK GUMBO. Seriously. A lot of Americans avoid duck. I understand, it can have a strong flavor. But in this gumbo, you'll love it!  The Duck & Andoillie Sausage Gumbo makes a broth that is so rich and full of flavor. I bet most people would think it's just well-seasoned chicken.  We moved to California, and every time we visit Phoenix, we stop by for the gumbo. The gumbo is made over hours of cookin' love, so it's also served real quick -- perfect for a lunch break.   It's nice to see that they maintained the same atmosphere from when they were at Town & Country in Phoenix. The bar looks homey and just a nice place to chill.

rGKp7Ju7AL95n4YggWMjAQ.text: Really good  authentic cajun food spot. Man do they hook you up with food, be sure to make room for leftovers lol The homemade chips are surprisingly amazing-Not too stale or too soft like most places. Next time i got i want to try the frog legs

IzsprprJz1LeGic31aRswg.text: My first visit.  Went with my mom and son so I tried a little more then what I ordered.  Combo basket with catfish and shrimp = delicious.  Red beans and rice = delicious.  Alligator & clam basket with sweet potato fries = good (but I blame that on my taste buds).  First time trying alligator, I don't think I like alligator and clams are not my favorite.  The sweet potato fries were delicious.  I've never had them before and I'm a fan now.   I also got a Hurricane - Yummy!  Strong and tasty.   My mom got the catfish dinner and said it was delicious,  My son got the Catfish Po'Boy and said that it was delicious.   Overall can't go wrong with anything you get here.  All the food was hot and fresh!

ro-mTDAWFNFBRo41MtoGDw.text: If you like live music and cajun food, Baby Kay's is for you.  Bae ordered the cajun burger and said it is one of the best burgers he's had.  I tried it as well and it was tasty (they mix Andouille sausage with their ground beef).  I order the jambalaya and it was very good.  I like dipping the meat in the crawfish sauce.  Speaking of, Bae ordered a side of crawfish with the sauce.  He wanted to try the etouffee since we had an amazing one in Huntsville, we were hoping to find a good local dish.  The waiter suggested the side which is essentially the etouffee minus the rice.  It was good, more seafoody than the Huntsville version.  Neither of us are big on seafood but it was still good.  Overall, Baby Kay's had a cute (but wide open and well-lit) atmosphere with great music and good food.  Would recommend to anyone looking for some genuine cajun food here in the southwest.

w_gtsqNSnAdtx5qPWM3qzg.text: Amazing dining experience! Great food and service! Had the gumbo and catfish with the  ettoufee!

6gLmh2RhGrke4buT3fH0xA.text: What a nice surprise!  Enjoyed the food. Great service and cool ambience  little one man sax  playing. Great date night!

VbFyoG8tL8oGqCNataVfzA.text: I haven't popped into a Baby Kay's since the good old days, when we restaurant staff would go hang out and drink with Remy after our dinner shifts near his original location in Scottsdale.  I remember the food being pretty awesome back then, but life and distance just got in the way of me ever going back............until last week!  This time, after checking my Yelpy app for some new local joynts to try, I found this location and decided it was time to see how things have been on the bayou front.  My Scottish buddy and I head over and are quickly attended by the oh so very lovely Heather, and are offered some yummy vittles for dinner.  The vibe is cool, the music perfect and the food...............delicious, with a slow heat build up in every bite.  Looking forward to my next visit, and hopefully, we get to see Heather AND her twin sister, for double the pleasure, like Wrigley gum, only much better eye candy.

BW6HNs6d6S3X2OVmsQvSNg.text: lulu wings were delicious. i had the catfish dinner with shrimp etouffee. delicious !!! loved the live music . wonderful place to enjoy a great meal.

JnMmi0MJIZU1u6uWWEC_FQ.text: Laissez les bon temps rouler at Baby Kay's! I love cajun/Louisiana style cuisine and was excited to try out this restaurant based on the good reviews and close proximity to my house. The last time I had eaten Cajun food at a restaurant was actually in New Orleans. :) We ordered some hush puppies, boudin balls, I had the Cajun combination and shared some bread pudding.  The hush puppies and boudin balls were perfectly crispy on the outside, with tender filling. I loved the boudin balls. They tasted exactly like those I had in New Orleans. The Cajun combination was a great way to taste all the typical Louisiana style dishes. The crawfish etouffee was my favorite of the three bowls. The jambalaya was interesting in that it wasn't tomato based, so for me it tasted more like a Cajun spiced fried rice. Quite honestly I've had so many different versions of this dish (With a few that I've tried in Louisiana) it's still hard for me to say what a typical jambalaya is supposed to taste like. It tasted decent, but the rice was very slightly undercooked and thus very slightly crunchy tasting. I had the chicken and sausage gumbo which was flavorful and filled with meat and veggies. I tried my friend's seafood gumbo which was by far superior due to the smoky, intense flavor from the dark roux. I also loved the complimentary garlic bread which was buttery, garlicky, toasty heaven.  The bread pudding was a sizable chunk and came with a bowl of whiskey sauce (We asked for it on the side). It was thick, dense, and filled with a ton of ingredients such as nuts and shredded coconut. The sauce was very light and tasted more like very lightly sweet, watery whiskey.  Service was good and our drinks were filled as needed. Our waitress had the foresight to ask if we wanted separate checks or one single bill since we were a party of 6 which I appreciated.   We went here on a Friday night and they had a musician singing and playing music, which might be a draw for some, but not so much if you are looking for more of a quiet environment where you can chat with friends. Good performance nonetheless by the musician.  I'll definitely come here if I'm craving Cajun style food for that lovely etouffee and seafood gumbo.

IMpz-v_TzGQROWYk0lKmfA.text: It is food adventure time or my friends and I again. This time, we were on our quest to try this newly opened Cajun food. When we first walked in, we saw a local musician playing music in the general dining area (what a great way to start our dining experience). The restaurant was extremely busy during business hour and that also means the food is good to me. We started our meal with two different appetizers. I forgot the name of the other one, but one of them was Boudin Balls. I love the apricot-pepper Jelly sauce and the crab cakes was absolutely delicious. As for dinner, I ordered a cajun combination that comes with crawfish etouffee, chicken and sausage jambalaya and substitute seafood gumbo over chicken with a side of green olive salad. All 3 of them were absolutely delicious, especially the crawfish etouffee. I didn't care for the green olive salad but my company seems to like it.   To complete the cajun dining experience, we ordered a bread pudding dessert and split it between all 6 of us. It was very tasty. If i wasn't so full, I would have probably ordered one just for myself. The reason i didn't give it a 5 star is because our server kept interrupting our conversation every time she came by. I even tried speaking very loudly to my friend the last time she came over and she managed to talk over me anyway. Argh! Can't you wait a little or say "excuse me" at least...?  Overall, I do enjoy my dining experience here and will definitely come back here again.

Unfortunately, I either walked into the wrong place or they are not making the same quality stuff anymore.  The "etouffee" I ordered was very much like a watered-down version of the filling in a Stouffers chicken pot pie - no pepper or spice of any kind and certainly no roux.  Then there were like 6-7 really puny shrimp buried in this mysterious liquid and the whole thing had this nasty old restaurant smell. It seemed really old.  I felt really ripped off by the $16.95 price & kept wondering if I had stumbled into an episode of Kitchen Nighmares!  I hope the rest of their food is better, but I would never go near that pseudo-etoufee again.

pHUTH0VjK-GlYL7aKvIYDQ.text: Yummy etoufee and gumbo! I'm in love with how delicious and reasonable the food is. Awesome live entertainment & specials. The service and atmosphere are very friendly and inviting. My kids even love it here...we'll be back...again and again.

m2i1I97gvBbro_bxJ-LqZQ.text: Who would think in the desert we'd find the best, authentic Cajun/Creole restaurant?! Folks, this place is the REAL deal. The owners are straight from Louisiana; read their story.   For an appetizer, we ordered the BBQ pulled pork sliders; they were perfect with a kick, but not too spicy. For dinner we shared a combination of dishes: the jambalaya, fried shrimp, seafood gumbo, sausage/chicken gumbo, and green olive coleslaw. The gumbo was pretty spicy but everything was insanely delicious...oh my, the flavors!! We ended with the bread pudding and best-I've-ever-had key lime pie. We didn't leave a crumb :)  The atmosphere is nice with live jazz/blues music. I swear I closed my eyes for a second and thought I was in NOLA! 5 star service. All around great place. Will definitely be back :)

xyWBr3I1AlGtdPncffN1AA.text: Went to Baby Kay's on a Friday evening. There was a 30 minute wait.  We ordered some hushpuppies for an appetizer. My wife ordered a 1/2 Oyster po-boy and gumbo and I orders the shrimp basket.  The hushpuppies came out with a horseradish sauce and ketchup. The hushpuppies were ok, kind of like Long John Silver's hushpuiies. The horseradish sause was excellent though.  The service this night was not very good. We waited almost 1 1/2 hours to get our entrees. The server steered clear of us most of the night, which made us angrier. If she would have communicated and offered a salad or something to tide us over, we would have understood.  We finally get our food and it is average at best. My wife's po-boy and gumbo were cold. My shrimp basket had 8 measly shrimp on it. We were really hoping for better, especially after the wait.  After our experience, we don't know how this place gets such good reviews.. food and service not good.

I think my only disappointment is in the limited menu. Various Catfish, etouffe, gumbo, jamabalaya, po' boy, and salads. That's about it. nBXMsfmNSONas8KTvKDUPA.text: We had the most wonderful birthday dinner at Baby Kay's, 2051 S. Dobson in Mesa, AZ, tonight for my birthday. I'm adding photos of Norma's lagniappe salad ("lagniappe" is a New Orleans word for a little extra, in this case Cajun sausage as well as bacon and a multitude of other goodies in the salad. I had Cajun fried catfish with a crawfish etouffe sauce, plus garlic toast and a choice of potato salad, olive cole slaw, or a side salad. I got a free dessert, sweet potato pie, lighter than more traditionally seasoned pumpkin pie, and Norma had key lime pie. A musician playing a fiddle and then a guitar to taped music was a delightful accompaniment, his New Orleans style songs adding so much to the background.

Our server was Martin S and he did a very good job considering he had two other large parties as well as our party of 8. While we were waiting for our meals our drinks were empty. At that time the owner checked on us and got us our refills. This was also when she informed us that Martin went to go help out the backed up kitchen. A few minutes later Martin came out and apologized for the wait. He then offered a round on the house! Although the food took a little longer to come out we were very pleased with our experience.
