The pieces looked like chicken nuggets so I dubbed my meal the Louisiana Happy Meal!    I would recommend you come on down and get a little Louisiana Cajun going on!!!

0XIBs3V-JFtlsX0tmkPZJw.text: Food great: service was uncomfortable/rude.  Food is very good, I have not had Cajun food very much so I cannot speak for authenticity. I can tell you however that the bartender who took my order was very rude. When I asked questions to understand the menu better she was short with me as if it was a inconvenience to explain. If it had been busy I could understand the need to rush, however it was not busy not to mention the attitude in facial expressions. I requested gumbo and placed an order for a entree which she mentioned a place in the combo selection she could modify to get what I wanted. I then was trying to understand the difference in the two items to see see if maybe I wanted something else but when I asked questions she told me "well I'll just take care of it on this end." On top of that before she walked away I asked for my gumbo first she said "well it's all ready to go at the same time, do you not want them at the same time?"   Long story short I have no idea what I ended up with as to opposed to what I ordered. I was unable to understand the menu as I felt like I was a pain in the butt customer for even asking questions. And getting another drink and a fork was an issue short of jumping up and down. But the food was very good. I definitely enjoyed eating it.

F3Rr1ggWRyum_n0E8-4XVA.text: Good. Authentic. Kinda pricey, but only "kinda" Good.... not many healthy options - but one prolly doesn't expect healthy with Canun

FKnf5zrjTk5xR_qufIds0g.text: Been wanting to stop in for a while and just never did. But today was different and I'm really glad i did. Food was great, atmosphere seemed authentic, and the service was amazing. Val took the lead and guided me through the menu which was really nice for a first timer. Congrats to the staff and the owners should be proud!!  Keep up the good work!!!  Definitely get the duck and sausage gumbo!!!!

YN8fIrCjP3qGBUQOcm3Wyg.text: This place has its hits and misses for me.  In generally the staff was friendly and pretty quick. The beer selection here is simply not good; they carried only one ipa from Abita,  and it was marginal at best.    We shared an order of hush puppies and the cajun combination plate with seafood etouffe, chicken and sausage gumbo and jambalaya. The hush puppies were super delicious! The combo plate however left us both wanting. We both loved the etouffe, thought the jambalaya was just okay and didn't like the gumbo at all. I tried a few times but there is some sort of spice that was sweet and overpowered the dish.   We did enjoy the live music and the very relaxed atmosphere. I won't be running back here, but might try the etouffe again sometime.

IgzUWCE2gelxRTtwg9zupg.text: This place is awesome. I haven't had any Cajun food like this in this half of the states. Prepare to clear your sinuses and your head. Fresh food and the catfish - better than home cooked or anywhere! Owner or manager, returned what I left behind on my way out. I was more concerned about my leftovers than my wallet! My family eats here often, reservations, call ahead, third party delivery. So grateful to have you all in the neighborhood!

GAeMPXgj3aQFeX1QB0a5Ww.text: AMAZING, authentic food! Service was excellent as well!  It was our first time there and we were blown away by how great the food was...we will definitely be back!

3rnrLImF5sM_qjJ5BXB4nQ.text: Authentic Cajun food. Live Music. Family / locally owned. Don't be fooled by the strip mall location, this place is awesome.

dKaTLpnnH1W7jV86sKAtJQ.text: Very accommodating for my gluten-free needs. Great place to eat! I go with others that say the fried chicken on Thursdays and the pork chop on Fridays are a must have! Definitely want to check out this neighborhood find!

MFdBcp0yVBPbBEX0ki3ZyQ.text: One of my wife's friends who loves New Orleans told us about Baby Kay's. We celebrated New Year's Eve 2015 going into 2016 AD there for dinner. Wowsers!!! Give this place a try! I'd only ever had gumbo at other places; Baby Kay's has a terrific menu! They have a full bar and music on the weekends too.  The food was phenomenal, the service was stellar and the prices were fair. The restaurant was clean and had a fun ambiance. We shall return AND will recommend this fine establishment to our family and friends!  A solid 5 stars!

I don't know much about Cajun food specifically, but I was pleased with my takeout experience.  The woman who took my phone order was also very helpful in finding me good menu options.

o6NRzoVZjPOzp7nCAHbFjA.text: If your idea of authentic Cajun is at a fast food chicken resturant than you haven't had real Cajun food.  Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen located near Dobson Road  and Baseline Road in Mesa Arizona is only place in the valley for authentic Cajun food.    If I had to sum up my experience here in a few words it would be great food, great atmosphere and great experience.   Come for  gumbo and stay for the live music.  Just make sure you save room for the desert. I recommend the ice cream sunday.    Rain or shine come for   food so that taste  divine at Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen. You will find me there.

b98cVP9-8Otm882ZUDE-Cg.text: Fun little spot! Customer service is friendly! The food was amazing! Seafood Gumbo, Fried Catfish we're very good! Strong drinks (Hurricane) very tasty! It did take a little long time for the food to come to the table, but I don't imagine that's the norm.

Ddur3Wx7cjmwblMnEjCTfw.text: Where to begin...  food is outstanding.  My favorite is crawfish etouffe but the shrimp remoulade was delicious as well, having a white creamy horseradish sauce that had a bite but not too hot.  Wonderful flavors.  Rice and beans were also really good.  Salad with creole dressing was delicious.  Drinks were consistently good.  Outdoor seating area where you can have dogs was a plus.  Service was very good and people were friendly.  Prices reasonable.  Bread pudding wasn't great, though - way too firm for my taste.  I found myself going back to this place frequently - I now love Cajun food!  This place is a must-try.  Start with crawfish etouffe, you'll be glad you did.

2j2tAyrm0fwppaXH-29wCw.text: Excellent, real Louisiana feel and awesome food! Loved the crawfish etouffee and great selection of Anita beer.

Kgs_hi8hc07RXEeK2eijGg.text: We used to go to the Baby Kay's in Scottsdale and are so happy to have found it in Mesa!  It's also great that they now take reservations.  Dustin was our waiter and was very helpful and friendly.  The crawfish etouffe (recommended by Dustin) was outstanding as was the red beans and rice.  The blues entertainment made you feel you were really in New Orleans.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

LWapTO3TDyunZQU8aC2S1g.text: Pros:  - I really enjoyed the live music  Cons: - The service was not outstanding (our server had a bit of a bad attitude) - Food was meh at best, I had the jambalaya which was dry, and spicy. I appreciate the heat but have had so much better. Hubby had the chicken gumbo, he thought the flavor was good but nothing special.  - chocolate cake was a refrigerated Costco slice sold, resold for $7 a slice when the entire cake is only $16 (been a member for 10 years it's my fav choco cake so I know it when I have it).  I appreciate having a Cajun spot in the area, but I am very underwhelmed. For two our bill was over $55. Won't return here but if anyone could recommend a truly great spot I'd be happy to check it out (:

fQ8J9beJ_2_W4yIP34W5bg.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere. Feels like I'm back in the south. This will probably become a favorite spot for us. We love this. The live music was also a great plus.

aryAp5OO7pFrIHVpNXq_Tg.text: I've been to Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen a few times as it is in my neighborhood and had a nice meal every time. This recent trip brought me here to satisfy a quick craving for crab cakes. I was lucky to find them and a crawfish etoufee on the happy hour menu. The crab cakes were good, a little more fried and toasted more than i would like but they still had a great taste inside. The etoufee was delightful had good flavor and something I look forward to ordering again. I have also visited the restaurant when they had fresh crawfish boils and that was a magical experience I highly recommend!

MsJU7y8r3V8DYXZ843mfMA.text: 4 stars because it didn't quite beat my absolute favorite Cajun restaurant, but that doesn't mean it wasn't awesome!   I was impressed with the duck and sausage gumbo during my first visit to the place - the meat was high quality and it had a more unique flavor to the gumbo that I hadn't had before, but definitely liked!   My wife had the jambalaya a la carte - her personal favorite - and ordered a side of crawfish sauce to pour on top of the jambalaya. She was raving over it! Her recommendation is, if you like crawfish, THAT is the way to do it!! If not, the jambalaya by itself is absolutely delicious!   We will certainly go back. They have awesome sounding specials including tender pork chops, and seafood enchiladas. We are also excited about the live music. Happy hour deals are great as well! This place may become a new favorite for sure!

bfAkrERLwXnfBfBe08n7RQ.text: This place is sooooo good.  First of all, the live music is great. It's a little loud if you are looking to have a large group. The food though, that makes up for anything you could ever find wrong. Seriously, it's that good.   I tried the chicken and sausage gumbo, the jambalaya, and the crawfish etouffee. All three were amazing. The etouffee was to die for. I could have eaten that for hours. It came with garlic bread and salad. The garlic bread is killer too. Seasoned perfectly. The salad was great. Tried it with a mango habanero dressing.  Service was outstanding. For a group of 20 people, they served us beautifully as if we were a small crowd. Overall an absolutely fantastic place.   We went with a large group as part of our Friday night foodies group. There was not one person who didn't rant about how good everything was. We have been to a variety of over 20 different Restaurants and this was by far everyone's favorite. Some even said we should stop going to other places and go here instead EVERY WEEK.  Don't just think about going here. Get the keys, jump in your car and go! It's just that good.

50JICjYYdbzNSB_SoUpC_A.text: This is a first visit for us, and we're glad we decided to stop in for dinner on a Saturday evening. The hospitality is wonderful here and so is the food. We got the Baby Kay's Combo and the Cajun Combo. Pay no attention to the smaller portion sizes because the quality of the food more than makes up for it!  For dessert, it was pecan pie with vanilla ice cream. So good!! Add in live music and this was  great experience from start to finish!

fmQU8ta5i8cX8fAR_5hRCQ.text: Amazing cajun southern Louisiana dishes. Crawfish etouffe comes with alot of crawfish and a bit spicy but delicious. Half soup gumbo and catfish sandwhich for a great price. Crunchy fish packed with just enough spicy. Came for lunch to try out and plan to go back. The menu said they had 2 locations, tried Mesa and next on list is Scottsdale. The dirty rice is to die for and they have live entertainment on Fridays and Saturdays. I approve of this joint!

vzk-Qji6eXt6OwGERuljOw.text: Excellent food all around, the Crawfish Etoufee is highly recommended. Also won't go wrong with the Catfish, Jambalaya, LuLu wings and Gumbo! Happy hour is 2-6pm.

qNSuZxt3AVvtG6uV6lILpg.text: I've been waiting to update my review until after I got myself back over here to try their Thursday night fried chicken.  I'm convinced there is nothing bad on this menu.  There isn't even anything just ok or mediocre.  It's all great.  My husband and I sat at the bar last night after a long day of work.  It seriously should have been Friday yesterday.  Sure felt like it.  The sign out front said, "a hurricane will take away your pain".  OK.  Two hurricanes.  And an order of LuLu wings please.    Ah.  The world goes away.  The man and woman taking turns working behind the bar are so friendly and funny that it's hard to stay in a bad mood.  And there was a father/son pair sitting at my left elbow and they were fun to talk to as well.  This was their first visit to Baby Kay's and they enjoyed what they ate, but they were eyeballing our wings, so I gave them one.  They said, "We know what to order next time!  Those wings are delicious!"  Yes they are.    We also ordered the fried chicken dinner which is perfect to share because it's a half chicken, 2 sides, and some garlic bread.  We got ours with the green olive cole slaw and dirty rice.  We also tried Abita's Andygator which is a helles doppelbock.  What?!?!  Somebody pinch me!  Am I drinking beer in Germany with Cajun music in the background?  Loved the dinner and the beer.  Great all around.    Since my last review, we were also in on a Saturday night for the smothered pork chop special.  That pork chop is nothing short of amazing.  It's so tender it just falls apart, and is covered with a rich brown gravy.  Mmmm...mmmm...that's some good eatin', Clark.  I want to go back and get that for sure.  So, yeah.  Still great food and great service.  Baby Kay's has become one of our favorite places.

ymGnphdsDlHmyls1l4hl8Q.text: Fantastic food! Reminds me of my southern roots. They did not disappoint. The Boudin Balls are amazing and the beer battered shrimp special was amazing. I would definitely recommend the gumbo and the etouffee.

-oUXM3oUpM4uul7G1Sg6Rg.text: Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen 2051 S Dobson Rd Mesa, AZ 85202  I had not eaten at Baby Kay's since it was located at Town and Country Shopping Center a long time ago. It was time for a new review.  Companion and I arrived at lunch time and were seated immediately. Our waitress took our orders for drinks and provided the requisite menu's for us to peruse. Most of the food on the menu appeared to be authentic Nola, at least if the taste held up to the descriptions.   Companion wasn't up on Cajun food, and asked if she could sample one or two things she was considering. Because heat from spice was not something companion enjoyed, she wanted to make sure she would be able to eat what she ordered. Our waitress promptly brought out 3 small cups with etouffee, jambalaya, and swamp water (gumbo for you northerners). Companion tasted all 3 and decided on the etouffee. I couldn't resist tasting them also. The jambalaya had some nice heat but no tomato in it, and the gumbo was True to tradition.  We each started with a cup of etouffee. We were brought plates with some excellent garlic bread on it along with a small bowl of the etouffee. Adding a bit of hot sauce to it and I was in New Orleans! A wonderful broth loaded with crawfish tails with a nice ball of white rice in the center. Companion ate her bowl without hot sauce and fell in love with it. This was the start of a wonderful lunch.  I got the combination basket which had fried shrimp and fried oysters in it along with the most unusual cole slaw I have ever eaten. There is no doubt in my mind that the chef who prepared this basket really knew what he was doing, as the shrimp and oysters were cooked to perfection. Companion had never eaten fried oysters before, and after one taste pronounced them delicious and decided to help me eat mine! The word thief comes to mind. The breading was perfect, and the oysters were a nice size and perfectly creamy. The shrimp, which most places overcook until they resemble something made from butyl rubber, were beautifully prepared, and were delicately tender. As for the cole slaw, what made it so unique is that it is prepared using green olives as one of the seasonings. It was highly unusual, and I still haven't made up my mind whether I like it or not. I'll probably have to go back a few more times to sample it some more.  We finished off lunch with their bread pudding in a puddle of whisky sauce. The bread pudding was dense, covered in pecans, and had coconut in it. I was so full that I could only eat a small amount of it, and companion asked for a box to take it in.  There was only one downer for the lunch, and that was a Sazerac that was ordered from the bar. Unfortunately, it just didn't make the grade and had to be sent back. My understanding is that they used to have a bartender that made a terrific one, and when she left they stopped making the drink. I'm hoping in the future they get a bartender that can make a proper Sazerac cocktail.  The place was clean, airy, with excellent service. Those who wish to can eat outside. Each table had a selection of hot sauces, mostly from Tabasco. I would suggest that they have some Louisiana Hot Sauce available also, as it has a totally different flavor than Tabasco.   For those who might be inclined to say that this is an expensive place to eat, may I remind them that this is the desert and sea food has to be brought in and is also costly. It all adds up in the end.  4 Stars

eSL6vqo1Xl4DS55wevISgA.text: Really satisfying meal with delicious flavors and dishes.   We ordered the seafood gumbo, sausage gumbo, etouffe, jambalaya, and everything was 5-star worthy. Our server was also really attentive and gave us some great recommendations with the New Orleans beers.   I wish they were at a better location, because they deserve to be busier with such great food.   Looking forward to coming back!

Al_tP4AmmS8Pa_xTrfTTbw.text: Came in and got the shrimp etouffee & jambalaya combo. The etouffee has such a great flavor! I've been craving it ever since. It is Creamy and has a mild kick to it. It was a drier version and kind of reminded me of some kind of creole fried rice. I enjoyed both but definitely recommend the etouffee!

MvzIVpq0Ct3RqfhKjm9OYA.text: We had been big fans when it was at the Biltmore.  We were so disappointed this time. It was not busy when we came in. EArTXI7j5T_m_3g5wSu5ag.text: If you're a purest when it comes to Cajun food, then this is the place. The atmosphere compliments the authentic food and service was acceptable. I have made this my go-to spot whenever I crave Louisiana Cajun style cuisine.

sP_7WXnVtBYjvjbS0IDl7Q.text: Incredible food, great service, great prices! The side salad was fresh, cold and     a great value.  I had the shrimp etufe and it was amazing. Spices were perfect, portion size was good (having the 2nd half for lunch and it's even better). Drink menu was good- had an Irish Mule- and my husband had a Hurricane. Only disappointing thing was the bread pudding and mostly because it wasn't what I was expecting. Dense and flavorful but somewhat dry. Will get the bourbon sundae next time. Great experience- I will definitely go back.

lR2w4alkDnlLD1jbJLh0EQ.text: Cajun delicious.   Enjoyed shrimp etoiffe seafood gumbo and chicken and sausage jambalaya.   All was prepared well from recipes from original owner Kay.   Wonderful service.   Had crab cake. Would not recommend.   I would recommend and will be back.

G4fg9MA1bkdCrR5HZXppng.text: We are from Houston Tx and we know good food.  The drinks were good, the LuLu Wings are succulent. I love the olive cole slaw and Gumbo as well.   Excellent service as well.

bDDEYU4y8XpxNzR3oS7iIQ.text: After driving by numerous times we finally stopped in. I got the Cajun combo with etoufee, gumbo, and jambalaya. While all were good, next time I will get the etoufee! It was rich and creamy with just enough spice!

ZjsGm17tsvT0r0_rBjtC0Q.text: After dining in once I knew I was hooked but I just recently found out they do take-out as well! The jumbalaya is easily the best thing on the menu (green olive cole slaw is a close second...good thing they include it for my side) and the prices are right. Score!  Great service, good vibes, and the food always comes out hot and consistently delicious! I recommend Baby Kay's to everyone willing to try some real New Orleans/Creole cooking!

wkWAtmpkK9brjGbJQ3ytMg.text: By far my favorite  restaurant  in the east valley. Great Cajun cuisine every time! Seafood gumbo is my go to dish of choice. The pork chop Fiday night special is amazing, thick tender and smothered  in brown gravy. The boudin balls with the spicy jelly are a great combo of spice and sweet. Happy hr.  from 4-6 has great affordable snacks . Service is excellent and the weekend blues guitar provides a bit of NO flavor.

LI7lZc_754aFdsYJW8mUEA.text: Tried this for first time. We had the catfish dinner. Food was excellent. Service was a bit slow considering that the dinner rush was over. Prices a little high I would have given a five except for service and prices.

RzVroO6Zu0KYlDZJsqeK9g.text: I was shocked .. Heard great things about this place... Went there to celebrate Fat Tuesday expecting great food and I was really disappointed... Do not get the crab cakes... Fishy and full of filler.. Shrimp are not much better... Gumbo is u flavorful...Service was sooo slow, they were busy but over an hour for food? And no apology, my daughters grilled cheese was cold and no longer melted.

RnOOGUtRzY9MSW7xsKL0MQ.text: Stopped here tonight for the first time, and was blown away by the catfish dinner with crawfish sauce. Do yourself a favor and try this, you will love it!

k63oU5TamozkTXmVWO-pcA.text: Went to baby Kay's for the first time told waiter we wanted separate checks waiter said ok.  (30ish dark hair with tattoos.said he could do that but then when check came we had to try and figure out our own bills because he put it all together ,  we were not happy.  Then looking at Bill they had charged one of our people full price for crab cakes when they were ordered as happy hour appetizer.  Let's see13.00  verses 5.00 for happy hour.  Waiter said it was miscommunication between said person and him (waiter). No just him.  Now for food... Crab cakes had no flavor,  hush puppies were awesome.  Sauce for them awesome.  . Red beans and rice with andouille sausage was very very good very spicy good flavor salad was good . The fried chicken was good dirty rice was good the wings are awesome would I go back ? Not sure very pricey and have had better.

Y1gQRdhrLccdjQGdcskcow.text: Service  is very good. Garlic bread  was very good . We liked their  hush puppies.  Tried their  gumbo. Best dish that they serve.  Also tried their  etouffe it was good . Also tried the  pecan pie. It was average  . . Loved their staff

sr6fGmiSrm7y9JaAC8QeOQ.text: Some of the best Cajun food I've had in a long time. Beautiful gumbo, Po Boy sandwiches are phenomenal. Service was friendly and attentive, but not overbearing. I'll definitely come back for a little more southern goodness. :)

dE1Nph_kkg2B4AoWDsowXw.text: I've been back to Baby Kay's several times since my initial review and I have decided to upgrade my rating to 5 Star! I love everything I have ever been served there, and the catfish with crawfish sauce is to die for! I should've given them five stars to begin with!

1RFCqIgaTrd4y5KAs9nZ3w.text: Loved the wings here and the etouffe was wonderful. Service was good and the orders arrived in good time. First time here and now it will become one of my favorites. Crab cakes were also good and the hush puppies too. Red beans and rice were also enjoyed by all who ordered them. Blues music played by a guitar soloist Thursday Friday and Saturday nights

MygLJiqgNiGWyEOtQze6Uw.text: Baby Kay's is right in my neighborhood but I just hadn't taken the time to try it - HUGE mistake on my part.  Food was outstanding.  I had the pork chop (strongly recommended by our server) and it was fantastic.  Can't wait to go back to this place.   PS: I started with a cup of gumbo and I'll get a bowl next time! :-)

iY_zyaGgEbcT307y5CHloA.text: What a great experience! Excellent service with food to match. I've had Cajun other places but they really do knock it out of the park here. The portions are very good size too. What they call a cup of soup is literally what all other places call a bowl. Highly recommended!!

eBh5KjkUBpVS6Lt7OFjwCA.text: Awesome food, good service, perfect amount of heat. Seafood Gumbo and the shrimp and catfish po boy was to die for. I also liked that I was curious about several items on the menu and the server even offered to give me a sample. One of which was the etoufee that alone will make me come back next time to try that.
